description:
Love ordering through DoorDash or postmates for delivery. Pretty fast and decent food. The sesame chicken, string beans, and Mongolian beef are the best. Don't order the Chinese chicken salad (wasn't bad but I've had it so much better at other restaurants that it was disappointing. Really lemony and drenched in dressing). Also the walnut shrimp is good but when you order to go they put sauce on the side and honestly don't put enough. 

Overall good food and they give lots of it! Meals for days or good for sharing!
author: Melissa L.

description:
I'm a flight attendant and I was staying on a layover in a nearby hotel. I ordered delivery because I was dead-tired and also a little lazy. 

The food was delicious, I ordered enough for five people because I wanted to taste everything! My favorite was General Tso's Chicken. It's similar to orange chicken, but less tangy and more savory. I also purchased the crab puffs, spring rolls, and pot stickers. The only item I could have done without were the pot stickers, but everything else was great.

The food was delivered way faster than initially estimated and everything was correct. I would definitely go there again.
author: Yaima M.

description:
Ordered delivery (via Postmates) for the first time last night.  The food was ready fast which is a plus as I waited until I got home for dinner before ordering (usually order dinner on my way home so it's ready when I get there). 

Ordered the following:

Crab puffs - my roommate loved them!
Egg flower soup - eh.  It was a little bland for me, I added salt and soy sauce to bring a little more flavor to it.
Sweet & sour chicken - this was tasty!
Chicken & green beans - I liked that the green beans weren't soggy but also not too crisp and raw, cooked well.

Overall I would order from them again but maybe try a different soup.
author: Anita T.

description:
Amazing that somewhere could produce such freshness and quality when there meals were ordered takeaway . 
The dumplings were fantastic and the lemon chicken among the best we have ever had.
author: Matt S.

description: Quick spot for easy lunch, parking on the street, I ordered #21 Salt & Pepper deep fried fish fillet - topped with dried chili, served with white rice.  You will get a small bowl of sweet & sour soup and a crab cheese puff before your main dish is served.  The dish I got was very tasty which fulfilled my lunch craves nicely.
author: Nat T.

description:
If you are looking for delicious Chinese, stop looking and place your order.

This is actually the second time I've ordered from them in as many weeks.  I ordered through Yelp Delivery both times.  Both times my order arrived on time, piping hot (almost burned my tongue!), and correct.  What more could you ask for?!

The sweet and sour chicken was delicious, full of tender good quality chicken.  The cream cheese wontons are great too!

The only slight bummer is that they forgot a soy sauce packet the first time, but considering I got one the first time, I'm guessing it was a fluke.

The delivery driver driver came directly to my door and was very polite both times.

Free delivery and and a low minimum.  Just overall a perfect find.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I got food poisoning after eating here last night.

I ordered the sesame chicken and soup dumplings. They both tasted good at the time, but nothing -nothing - is worth how I felt 6 hours later.

Be careful eating here.
author: Andrea D.

description: I've ordered here about 10 times for delivery and overall have had a great experience with them. Delivery is around 45 minutes and quality is consistent. They cut holes in the packaging to ensure texture of food stays crispy through the steam. Mongolian beef& general tsos chicken  & sesame chicken are great for takeout nights.
author: Mimi Y.

description: I have to say I really enjoyed my take-out from Elaine's Kitchen. I got sesame chicken and it was pretty great. It was crunchy on the outside and yummy on the inside. I am excited for my next order.
author: Tina L.

description:
Omg!! First off, I have to laugh at these people who uploaded a photo saying they got a broken container! You know they do that on purposes so your food won't get soggy from the moisture? Lol!! Wouldn't you notice by seeing all these other people uploading the same container? Anyway, enough sticking up for this crappy place.

I already knew I was going to rate his place a one star when I took a bite out of my potsticker and oil shot at the back of my throat. That was my first bite too! The chowmein had to flavor. It was bland and I felt like I was wasting my calories. The fried rice wasn't good either. Bland as well. It's so bad that my dog sniffed our Chinese food and didn't even want a taste.

The string beans we ordered sat in our fridge for 2 weeks until we decided to clean our refrigerator and ended up throwing it away. 

We should of listened the Yelp reviews before we wasted $50.
author: Darlene M.

description:
Very impressed, had lunch here today with a group of 9, staff were very accommodating. Everyone loved the food so much that we went back for dinner with a group of 17 with kids of all ages. Once again, very accommodating.  The food was delicious. Difficult to pick favorites, we ordered many different things everyone was happy.  Staff was even willing to go off menu for a picky eater. 
Fried foods like sesame or orange chicken were crispy with a thin coat of batter and all white meat. Curry chicken and chow meins each had loads of flavor.  Cream cheese crab puffs were more interesting than most. Loved the salt and pepper fish.
This place is highly recommended,  you should go there now.
author: Michael M.

description: This is probably hands down THE worst Chinese food I have ever had. We looked at the reviews and decided to go for it, since people love the food here. Boy were my husband and I sadly mistaken. I have never seen more grease on food in my life, I think the oil was rancid or something. The beef lo mein, I cannot even describe the taste. I'm gagging now just remembering it. Steer clear and go somewhere else! This will not satisfying any type of Chinese food cravings and you will be upset at wasted money and an upset stomach.
author: Kiera L.

description: I ordered on my mobile. The food was great. It came much faster than I expected!!! I ordered the orange chicken, broccoli beef and the crab cheese puffs. All were delicious and fresh. The delivery person was polite and friendly. The serving size was very generous as well.
author: Olive R.

description: I bought a Kung Pao Chicken Lunch special meal & it was super delicious with the right kind of spices & lot of chicken cubes thrown in. Took me a while to eat all of it but one of the best Chinese joints in SF Downtown.
author: Abhishek S.

description: Insanely fast delivery, and the sesame chicken is SO CRISPY and DELICIOUS! This is my new favorite Chinese restaurant in the city.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I've lived near Chinatown for nearly 7 years. I am usually skeptical about the cleanliness and authenticity when it comes to eating chinese food especially near chinatown(s). I order food here about 2x a month. I'd recommend broccoli beef, Mongolian beef, orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken for entree choices. Personally my favorite meal on the menu is the lemon  chicken with a side of white rice. The staff is very friendly and the kitchen appears to be sanitary and clean :) 
I love eating here , I've never been dissatisfied nor have they ever messed up my order.
author: Lisa W.

description: I don't know how but I have never had a bad place to eat from Yelp. Elaine's Kitchen was no exception. I had a shrimp and walnut dish that was very delicious and out of the ordinary taste wise. Also the crab wantons were very good. Lastly I feel the price was a good value for this city.
author: Wlliam C.

description:
Maybe my new Chinese to go place! Sesame chicken was cooked perfectly and not smothered in sauce. Also fast deliver despite what yelp said on the estimated time. They came in half the time and food was still hot! 

For the reviews about the "broken" containers, this is intentional so your food doesn't get soggy! It lets the steam out. 

My chicken and honey walnut shrimp came crunchy and crispy due to this. (sauce also came in a separate container which also helped! 

So good!
author: Anna T.

description:
I ordered late night take-out and was not disappointed! I got the pork pot stickers and the sesame chicken. Both were very good and fresh. The food arrived about an hour after ordering and was a little like warm, so minus one star on that. Otherwise, very good and I will definitely order from them again.

Note: the delivery guys will call/text and ask you to come down to their car to retrieve your order,  so keep your phone handy!
author: Cassie B.

description:
**MealPal Review** 

Elaine's was very filling and tasty. I got mapo tofu with rice and I was stuffed by the end (which can be an issue with MealPal meals). A container stuffed with white rice and tofu. While it was very good, I wish there had been some kind of vegetable to make the meal less heavy. Excited to go back for MealPal as well as just going back to try different options on their menu.
author: Bito M.

description:
Great service
Big portions
Low prices
Delicious food 
And especially love the General Tso's Chicken
author: Chantelle S.

description: Such good food! Came for the lunch special and ordered lemon chicken with fried rice. Chicken was crunchy with right amount of sauce and rice was well prepared.
author: S C.

description: I love this place! They give you more than enough food, it's all exactly the americanized Chinese food you were looking for! Also their breaded chickens (sesame, orange, general tzo, etc) kinda tastes like funnel cake. 0.o I'm not complaining though. Delicious!
author: Grayson K.

description: Haven't ordered for delivery in a while been trying to be a penny hoarder. Anyways decided to order Chinese food. Been wanting and craving for some. Saw that I had a few extra change left after paying SF rent....and oh man this was good. The delivery guy was cool as well. Will be ordering more in the future once staying home and watching tv starts paying more $$
author: Jordan S.

description:
Honestly I don't know why it has so many good reviews.
I came here to grab lunch and ordered the wonton soup, it was not good at all. :/
I had some spring rools too and they were oily and tasted weird.
Service was not good either.

Sorrym but I'm not coming back.
author: Brigitte S.

description:
Not a fan. The Honey Walnut prawns were mixed with a buttery sauce and the white rice was over cooked.

The war wonton soup was good though. They had plenty of meats
author: Eric T.

description: Went here because of the solid Yelp reviews.  Got beef with mixed vegetables, chicken with string beans, rice and one tea for 30 bucks.  Not a bargain bite place but still reasonable for SF.  Food was good white boy Chinese. Both my friend and I thought it was delicious .  I'll probably be back again - just wish it was a tad bit cheaper. Staff was friendly and nice! So points for service.
author: Robert C.

description:
Amazing food! Bang for buck. They give big portions for a super low price. The food is well made and I highly recommend the mapo tofu (if you like soft tofu) because the sauce, when mixed in with white rice, is perfect!

I will definitely be returning and telling friends about this place!
author: Eric P.

description: This such a great place, I loved the decoration,the art on the walls, are all very fascinating. Our waiter was so nice even when we spilt water she cleaned it up, moved us to a different table, and made sure we satisfied with our seating. She also had great advise on what to order. The food had perfect portions and was extremely delicious and most places that serve orange chicken make it too sweet or unusually bright orange but this place actually put a orange flavor in it, that made it so great. I think this is the best Chinese food I have ever had and I wish it was in the town I live in so I could have it all the time. But when I come back to San Francisco I will come here. I highly recommend this place to any Chinese food lovers.
author: Theo _.

description:
So good!! I ordered takeout and the estimated delivery time was 60 minutes. They ended up getting here in 20 minutes which is extremely impressive! The delivery fellow was extremely nice as well. 

Now for the food - I ordered wonton soup, General Tso's Chicken, and steamed rice. The wonton soup was very good. Not the type of wonton soup I'm used to but still very delicious. The General Tso's chicken was AMAZING. It was so perfectly crispy. 

Quick delivery, great food, good price. Highly recommend!
author: Mallory S.

description:
Solid Chinese delivery place! Ordered from GrubHub, food came hot and fresh and on time. 

Crab Rangoon and Egg rolls were crispy and good. We got the crab Rangoon for free for spending over $35 I believe.

Sesame chicken was yummy, although could've used a little more sauce.

Honey walnut shrimp tasted different, it had a very overpoweringly lemony flavor and batter was a little doughy.

Green beans were alright, not memorable.

Would pass on the cumin beef, too many onions and peppers. 

Is it the best Chinese delivery? Definitely not, but so happy to find a place that'll deliver to the food desert that is Mission Bay. Also, no GI distress afterwards :)
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Excellent sesame chicken. If the box they arrive in is broken in the corner, it's intentional so it can vent. 

General Tsao's chicken might sound similar, but it's too soggy and more batter than meat. Skip that and get the sesame chicken instead.
author: Kristen S.

description: Food is great, and the location is wonderful! I have been eaten here of a entire year! The outfit is marvelous!
author: Sam L.

description:
Wasn't great, price was high. They did deliver to my
Hotel room though and got there fast!
author: Maci B.

description: Everything I ordered tasted a day old, seriously worst Chinese food I've ever had. There was a hair fried into a chicken wing. The Mongolian beef was mushy. $50 on delivery and we couldn't eat it. This is the first review I have ever done, it was that bad.
author: Jamie J.

description: The chicken chow main was like all noodles and little vegetables or chicken.  Like a brick of noodles.   I was disappointed I hope they improve the recipe.
author: Matt H.

description: Food is delicious. Please note, if your lid had a hole in it that's to let the steam out so it doesn't make certain foods lose their crisp like fried chicken or shrimp, etc.
author: Raquel T.

description: Took longer than promised, had tipped 20% online before hand, didn't bring it up to my hotel room, because they couldn't find parking and didn't leave utinsils to eat with, when I finally found a fork, found that the fried rice I ordered with no onions had onions. Horrible experience.
author: Chris M.

description: Did not like this place. I got the sesame chicken, and it was not good. I won't be coming back.
author: Kim H.

description:
Sometimes you hear so much about a place that you finally give in and be like "What the heck, time to give this place a shot!" So you go out your way even going to "The City" early to partake in what seems..(according to reviews) really good "Chinese Food" in North Beach. Was the result a great experience at the end of the day? Could I have gone elsewhere and had "Chinese Food"? Well let me yelp about it for a minute. Here is my review of Elaine's Chinese Cuisine.

6/21/16
I was feeling pretty good this day. It was sunny out and sporting my "SI Yankees" jersey not only in celebration of the MiLB victory but, MLB "NY Yankees" victory. Like as usual, I was hungry. And everyone knowing me.."I love Chinese Food" So with that being on my mind and Elaine's being in my site, I was ready to eat and see what the fuss was about..plus I need food on my stomach if I'm having a few drinks.

Service 3/5
Cleanliness 3/5
Food 3/5

Food/Service:
So I enter the restaurant and some of the staff are watching TV instead of maybe..cleaning tables, tending to hungry customers (me). It took a few minutes (Really) for a worker to see me from the kitchen and then came to take my order. So on this visit I decided to scan the menu. I of course was a bit late for lunch time so I had to order a la carte. After deciding on what I wanted, I ordered. Sesame Chicken ($7.95) and Shrimp Chow Main ($6.95). After about fifteen minuets, my to go order was placed and I took my food with me to eat at my favorite bar.

Sesame Chicken - It was the better of the two selected dishes. It was crispy, had a nice almost citrusy sauce. It was mild, and had a nice little ginger note to it that rounded off the chicken well. This is something I would order again. One of the better Sesame Chicken dishes I've had in a while. I would give this 5 stars alone really.

Shrimp Chow Main - This was a huge let down. The whole togo container had 5 shrimp in it. And the shrimp was the only really flavorful component in this dish. The noodles had zero flavor, the veggies had no flavor nor that nice snap that veggies seem to still have in good chinese food side dishes. This was very disappointing and will "Not" be ordered again by me.

Will I go back?

Sure, I like to give "Chinese Food" places another chance. Considering it's my "Favorite" food. And this place is in my favorite area of SF.

In Conclusion, I may not have had the best total first impression, but 1 out of 2 isn't to bad of odds to count this place out. It sits on Broadway in a heavily trafficked area where they are bound to have consistant business. As always if you visit, "Yelp" your own experience!
author: Tre S.

description:
I usually go for City Chopsticks when I get Chinese take-out, but I find their food to be pretty bland so I gave Elaine's Kitchen a try. I ordered: spring rolls, chicken fried rice, and Mongolian beef. 

The chicken fried rice was overall awful and I wouldn't get it again. It looked like just white rice with some soy sauce and chicken added to it. I can't even confidently say it was fried. It was also exclusively chicken and rice. Usually when I order at other places I expect there to also be eggs, peas and carrots, but no luck with that here. 

I asked for sweet and sour sauce to go with my spring rolls (one order has four!) and was given one tiny tiny container of sauce. It was enough for one spring roll, which was both annoying and disappointing. Gotta have sweet and sour sauce with your rolls. 

The saving grace of the review is their Mongolian beef. It's some of the best I've had so far in the city. They add in bell pepper and onion, and it was just the right amount of spicy with thinly sliced grilled beef. 

I'd be happy to order from them again to give it another chance, but stick with the meat options. It's fast, cheap, and normal huge portions of carry out Chinese food. They were also super nice, and I didn't get sick which is really all you can hope for when trying a new takeout place.
author: Jessica H.

description: We found this restaurant while walking around Chinatown. It's a few blocks away from the center of Chinatown, but easy/quick to walk to. The inside was clean and the staff (including Elaine herself!) were super friendly. We ordered orange chicken, shrimp chow mein, and kung pao chicken. They serve large portions and we ended up taking leftovers home. Everything was very well done and exceeded my expectations. I would definitely come back here again even if it's a little off the Chinatown grid.
author: Melissa A.

description:
The food is shockingly bland. Shrimp chow mein, fried rice, and general tso chicken were all very disappointing

We didn't even finish our order - which is really unheard of when it comes to Chinese food for me.
author: Matthew G.

description: Great food (some of the best General Tao/Gao chicken in the city) friendly delivery person (our address is hard to find and they were a real trooper about it!)
author: Jeff D.

description: Hands down the best Chinese food I've ever had. We visited San Francisco for a few days and dropped by here for lunch- The portions were ginormous so we dug in right away, the food was delicious, the egg fried rice was perfectly done, and the chicken chow mein hit the spot (they do not skimp on chicken!). Loved it and highly recommend anyone in the area to drop by. Very nice people too.
author: Karina S.

description: Where do I begin? Their food is so delicious. They don't overload their sauces with corn starch or wrap their sesame chicken in layers of dough like other Chinese restaurants, and the meat is always juicy and fresh. The portions are satisfying. Delivery is always swift and careful. And yes, they cut out the corners of takeout boxes so the food doesn't get soggy! When was the last time you received this kind of service on a $10 takeout? I can't say enough good things about them and I recommend Elaine's to absolutely everyone.
author: Carl W.

description:
Had the veggie potstickers, veggie fried rice and crab Rangoon/puffs and everything was tasty. The veggie fried rice has plenty of broccoli and some cabbage. I'm use to peas and carrots in fried rice but their exclusion did not diminish the taste. The veggie potstickers are moist and delicious. The crab puffs were kind of chewy but not greasy.

I ordered this meal from Yelp and had it delivered. It came right on time. They also included various soy and chili sauces. Definitely give them a try.
author: CJ C.

description: Solid restaurant. We enjoyed everything we got. One order each of orange chicken, general tso and crab puffs. All great items. We'd definitely go back. Very kind and efficient staff; food came out very quickly. Tasted fresh.
author: Erin J.

description: This review is for delivery. It took over an hour to get food delivered less than 2 miles away on a Thursday night. The chicken wings were crispy on the outside but literally flavorless. It was like eating crispy cardboard. In my order I asked for orange chicken extra spicy, and what I got was very very sweet mediocre orange chicken. Zero spice. Talking Panda Express quality. I also asked for it to be delivered to a hotel, I didn't think I needed to explicitly asked for utensils and napkins but apparently I did.
author: Jay E.

description: Had the dumplings and orange chicken and was just blown away!  Super tasty and the price is fair!  Also, the staff is very friendly.  I'll definitely be coming back regularly for some late night grub!!!
author: Mason W.

description: We walked a few blocks to get here but it was worth it. Authentic food, NO MSG, and great service. Stop in when you want a great meal.
author: Kristina R.

description: The food and service here is excellent. Before ordering delivery I had a few questions to ask so I called in and the lady who answered was super friendly and happy to answer all my questions before I placed the order. I ordered the garlic eggplant, veggie fried rice and vegetable rolls all so delicious and hot when it all arrived! Highly recommended!
author: Rita A.

description:
I secretly love this place. I dont really like Chinese food, but because of Elaine's I sometimes crave it...love the crab cream cheese puffs.
Don't expect michelin star food, it is what it is, a cheap and cheerful chinese place for a quick but decent meal.
author: E B.

description: Not bad but nothing to write home about either. I had the sesame chicken and General Tso chicken - both were somewhat bland. I ordered delivery and it took over an hour but I was staying at a hotel and they were good at communicating that they had arrived. $33 for the two dishes and rice.
author: Laura D.

description:
Ordered delivery from Elaine's and won't do it again:

Hot n sour soup - totally bland compared to other hot n sour soups I have had from other restaurants
Mongolian beef - sweet, bland and greasy
Mixed vegetables - mostly onion, bland, over cooked 
Fried rice - ok but have had way better
author: Ian W.

description: Mongolian beef is bomb! Orange chicken is delicious and a total step up from typical orange chicken (has candied orange pieces of some sort, sooo good). Lunch specials will deliver with sweet and sour soup and fried crab puffs! Fried rice is a great staple too.
author: Kari M.

description: Great place if you're in the mood for Chinese food; service was fast and food was delicious ! This was the perfect way to end our trip in the bay
author: Diana A.

description: The Mongolian beef tasted very good.  Just like the one that I ate in China.  The crab cheese puff is a new taste to me， but still very good！
author: Jingwen L.

description:
I just move to the North Beach and have tried several Chinese restaurants. Among them, Elaine's Kitchen is my favorite. Three times in a roll , I ordered take-outs from here: 

What I usually ordered:

General 's Chicken (white meat in good quality and crispy!)

Mongolian Beef( a little bit like grilled , sooo yummy!)

Egg Fried Rice ( huge portion and delicious!)

All in all, they have the very decent dishes and reasonable prices! Highly recommended!
author: Suman L.

description: Stopped here because the 4star rating and we weren't disappointed. We tried 3 dishes and shared between 2 people and it was more than enough. We only ordered that much to sample several things. The service was great and very fast. I'd recommend to anyone wanting great affordable Chinese food.
author: Tony W.

description:
SOO Delicious! I ordered delivery to my house as a first time customer here. I was a little nervous trying something new because I'm kind of picky about my food-- especially Chinese food! This place was so good on every level. 1) delivery did not take too long 2) the food was freshly made (orange chicken was still hot and crispy, same with the walnut shrimp and spring roles) 3) the way everything tasted was very delicious and you can tell they don't reuse the same oil over and over again which causes a gross overly-used-oil taste to the food. Definitely reordering from here!

What I ordered:
Orange chicken- 5star
Walnut shrimp- 4 star
Spring roles- 5star
White rice- 5 star (wasn't dry)
Miso soup- 5 star
author: Tina M.

description: Pretty decent for take-out. Easy location, decent prices, decent portions. I'd order take-out from them again!
author: Marie D.

description: I'm a food lover and Chinese food is one of my favorites, what's too appealing and important to me is the cleanses of the restaurant, I been to too many Chinese restaurants in different cities, some of them have great food but the clearness is not all there. This place is very clean, has great food and the prices are reasonable. I'm impressed.
author: Z H.

description: I always come here whenever i'm in town. Elaine's has a comfortable environment to enjoy a meal, responsive staff, the food is great, with big portions. I like the sesame chicken the best and the crab cheese as well. Highly recommended!
author: Kim F.

description:
We were visiting in the marina, needed some dinner and found Elain's kitchen had great ratings. They were right !

Not only was the food excellent, but the service was outstanding !  We made a little mistake on our order online and marked it as pick up instead of delivery. They called when we had come by to pick it up and delivered it graciously !

There are many places with great food. However, when they have great food, great service, and a great attitude, those are the ones we like to frequent. Thank you Elaine's kitchen for taking great care of us !
author: Ga K.

description: Got a lunch special with garlic eggplant and added small soup for a $1 extra. Not too bad. Plus they give you a pretty good sized portion.
author: Jes Y.

description:
I ordered two dishes for delivery; sweet and sour chicken, orange chicken. Both of these tasted very good, especially the orange chicken. The portions are respectable too.

The pictures were misleading though. The orange chicken is shown with a side of white rice. But the actual order did not come with it which was disappointing.
author: Sai Teja L.

description: We ordered delivery while in sfo from out of town. It is some of the best Chinese food we've ever had. Ingredients were fresh and everything was cooked perfectly. Delivery was SUPER FAST- way quicker than what yelp said and the delivery guy was very friendly and appreciative. Highly recommend Elaine's.
author: Peter B.

description:
Remember when Dustin Hoffman runs to the church at the end of "The Graduate", bangs on the window and yells, "ELAINE!... ELAINE!"? Well, that scene has nothing to do with this small, sparse Chinese place on Broadway amid the strip clubs and the drunken patrons. Unless you are drunk and in desperate need of Chinese food to satisfy your alcohol-derived munchies. Then, yes, you would be banging on Elaine's window to open up and give you something to devour. Jamie W. and I, however, were completely sober when we walked over here after a weekend up in Mendocino. I can't say the same about the loudish party across the room whose indecisiveness had Elaine in a bit of a tizzy. We were admiring her pluck.

Even though we had In-n-Out in Santa Rosa on the way back home, we still ordered a lot of food. We started with the $4.95 Spring Rolls which we always forget are not the freshly wrapped ones but the deep-fried ones with the requisite cherry sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/1KSS8Yl). Pure Panda Express level here, but Elaine compensated by giving us a $4.95 bowl of Hot & Sour Soup free of charge (photo: http://bit.ly/1RnSLLz). This was pretty good, not quite Henry's Hunan level but it did hit the spot to counteract the grease of the rolls. Since we are planning a trip to Shanghai later this year, I had us try their $6.95 Shanghai Pork Steamed Dumplings since it seemed like a good deal given you get ten in a bamboo steamer (photo: http://bit.ly/1GqknJH). They were pretty darn tasty.

They had the squish factor down, something Jamie and I will try to replicate at our planned dumpling making lesson in Shanghai. Jamie ordered his favorite, the $7.95 General Tso's Chicken, which were prepared with chicken tenders deep-fried in a garlic sauce. The steamed broccoli florets were wholly unnecessary (photo: http://bit.ly/1FPa5Yw). I felt we needed at least one vegetable dish, but I failed and went for the $7.95 House Special Eggplant, which had plenty of sauteed eggplant but also chicken, beef pork and shrimp (photo: http://bit.ly/1QRnrnR). So frankly there wasn't anything veggie about it. Maybe I should have eaten the broccoli florets. Anyway, Elaine's was way better than our expectations given the shady location, so maybe drunken window banging is in our future.

FOOD - 4 stars...bargain Chinese pretty good if you avoid the spring rolls, try the dumplings
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...not much to it except that it's clean
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...Elaine gets a lot of exercise coming in and out of that kitchen
TOTAL - 4 stars..."ELAINE!... ELAINE!" (bang-bang-bang)
author: Ed U.

description: Pretty solid chinese food. Tasted better quality than your average takeout. I got the sesame chicken, which I was very happy with. My friend got the general tso's chicken. The chicken was good, but the broccoli was a little too salty. We also got the potstickers, which themselves were good but the sauce that came with it was unimpressive. It was sort of a sour type sauce. Hard to describe, but not what I was expecting. I ended up dipping mine in soy sauce. Also, the portions are really big (like most chinese food places). I would suggest sharing with a group or just going for lunch (they looked like they had great lunch specials/deals).
author: Hannah K.

description: Oh my God this place is incredible General Tso's chicken could save a life and end a war
author: Jerrin L.

description: I love Elaine's! I typically order a basil fried rice, with extra basil and extra spicy. Comes out delicious every time. I wish they offered more "healthy" but delicious sounding options, so for now Elaine's is my go to cheat meal :)
author: Martha S.

description: Ordered General Tso's chicken and it was yummy! Ordered it to-go and it was ready in 15 minutes, they cut holes in the lid to keep the meat crispy. The only reason I didn't give a 5 Star review is because I wanted medium heat (just shy of spicy) and it didn't taste like there was any heat at all. This didn't take away from the overall experience, because the sauce was flavorful. The broccoli was perfectly cooked too.
author: Gabby R.

description:
Given how often I eat here, this review is severely overdue (but better late than never, right??)! Elaine's is simply the best comfort Chinese food in town, which is saying a lot since it is next door to Chinatown which presents a lot of stiff competition at dirt cheap prices. 

What sets Elaine apart from its Chinatown counterparts is the quality of the ingredients and preparation which is evident when you first sink your teeth into the food. I have never had a bad meal here and everyone I have brought here (either locally or from out of town) can attest that it is amongst the best Chinese food places they have ever had! The Crispy Sesame Chicken, General Tso's Chicken, Eggplant Special (with the various meats) and fried rice (pork is my favorite although just the plain egg fried rice is fine) are all to die for and I would eat them everyday if I could. The chow mein is also very good.

The prices are super reasonable, too, especially if you eat in the restaurant (Eat24 prices are slightly higher) and can make it for weekday lunch since they have an awesome lunch deal Monday through Friday - something to the tune of an entree, rice, hot and sour soup and a cream cheese wonton all for $6-8 depending on the entree with an option to add $1-2 to substitute white rice for fried rice or chow mein. I always leave waddling out of here or taking a small box to go for a little afternoon snack. Even if you don't make it for the lunch special, the regular portions are HUGE and you will definitely have leftovers if you order more than one item. 

What also sets Elaine's apart are the service and cleanliness of the restaurant which unfortunately leaves a lot to be desired at most Chinatown restaurants I've been to (I live in Chinatown and have made my way around the block). The staff who work here are very nice and the service is on point (your water cup will never be empty). Although I do get delivery 95% of the time, I enjoy eating at the restaurant every once in awhile to enjoy the food while it is piping hot. It's great when delivered but just a notch more delicious when it comes straight from the kitchen.

Trust me when I say you will be hooked instantly after trying this place! I know I am and will be coming here for all my Chinese comfort food needs for the foreseeable future.
author: Jonah L.

description:
Love Elaine's kitchen both for a sit-down restaurant and delivery! The restaurant environment is family friendly and the staff is attentive and welcoming. I personally come here for the Mongolian beef because I have not found one that tastes as good as the one at Elaine's. I also love coming here for lunch because the price is so cheap and the portions are huge (it's good enough for me to save some for dinner). 

As for delivery, their service is quick and the food comes in still hot and delicious. This is definitely one of my favorite spots in the city!
author: Therese G.

description: Delivery ONLY. Delivery was a whole hour later than indicated; total wait time was 2 hours + 15 mins. We live 0.5 miles away. SO the wait time for delivery is unreal. If they fixed this, I would order delivery more often. Also, food is 6/10 but could use some spices.
author: Chelsea G.

description: We ordered delivery on a Sunday night and were told it would be 30-45 mins, however, it actually took about 80 mins which was a bummer. The food itself was average for take out Chinese. We ordered beef and broccoli, lemon chicken, chicken fried rice, and chicken lo mein. The lo mein was pretty weak on flavor, and I wish the fried rice has some peas and carrots in it (just rice, chicken, egg), but for the portion size and price it sufficed. We'll order again because it's convenient, and when you have the hankering for take out Chinese it will do the job, but I wouldn't seek it out.
author: Kim A.

description:
Clean restaurant. Good hot and sour soup. Good crab rangoons - hot and fresh. Portions were big and lunch special was cheap. 

Unfortunately the general Tso's chicken was really skimpy on the meat. It was kinda dry, thin, and over-fried. I would rather eat at Panda Express. The fried rice was flavorless, dry, and completely forgettable. 

Probably won't come back here again with all the other options around.
author: Catherine L.

description: i would order from elsewhere.  i certainly won't repeat.  fried rice has no seasoning; sesame chicken is sweet, no spice and has an anise aftertaste that seems weird compared to any other sesame chicken i've had.  they forgot my crab puffs so that's annoying.
author: Emily T.

description:
Its hard to find good Chinese delivery, but Elaine's has been out to-go for quite some time. It's not greasy or overfilling. 

Having said that, I do have to say that they have strong and weak dishes. Their chow mein needs some work- no taste, just oily. Don't order this. Fried rice is great, but you need to order it with some kind of meat to give it a better taste. 

My faves at this place are General Tso's and the Kong Pao chicken. Anything with broccoli is also . The dumplings are also pretty amazing (I don't get them often enough).
author: Clarissa B.

description: Any of the breaded chicken dishes (orange, general tso's, sesame) are insanely good.  There is actually chicken, it's not 75% breading.  And the breading is so crispy and good.  Maybe one of the best general tso's I've had.  I've also had their chow mein w/ shrimp - and while it tasted very good, minus one star there b/c there were literally 4 shrimp in the entire order (all placed on top, so it looked like you were going to get a lot of shrimp throughout the dish).  Went here for lunch - stopped in and placed a take out order and it was ready super fast.  Would def come back!
author: Allie G.

description: Shrimp fried rice has a couple of shrimp in it. But the rice was absolutely blend and tasteless. Sesame chicken doesn't come with rice. Big portion but it was very burnt. Tasted like a rusty skillet. Not ordering from them again.
author: Maya K.

description: The food tastes fresh and delivered in about 20 minutes!!  This will definitely be a new go to for a quick and tasty bite.  Portions are great... we had leftovers for lunch the next day!
author: Makina P.

description: Just ordered delivery. Stuck to basics. Hot and Sour Soup. Very good. Combo Fried Rice delicious. Crab Puffs very good. All ingredients were fresh. Very pleased. Food arrived hot and well ahead of schedule. Condiments and utensils provided. Will definitely order from Elaine s again.
author: Michael M.

description: This place is pretty good.  I appreciate the low order minimum for free delivery.  It took about an hour to arrive all the way in Potrero Hill which was exactly the estimate so I was happy.  I got the Hunan Beef which I thought was a little mushy but it wasn't bad at all.  I'd probably order something else next time, maybe the Sesame Chicken since so many reviewers recommend that.  The hot and sour soup was solid and the delivery guy was friendly.
author: george c.

description: Try this place for the first time after seeing the reviews here. I must say this place is perfect. Customer service is great and they were on top of things. Also this place is clean compared to other Chinese restaurants. We tried a few items on the menu and was delicious, specially the Waton soup.
author: Mr.Food E.

description:
Stopped here when looking for a Chinese restaurant, and it didn't let us down as other Chinese food around Chinatown. 

We ordered Crab Cheese Puffs for starter , Mongolian Beef and Shrimp with Mixed Vegetables for entrees. 

The food was decent and the price reasonable! Will be back again!
author: Zexian L.

description: Good food and much more than I expected at a great price. Gave me a feel for the shops from back when I spent time in China. Would definitely recommend.
author: Marshall J.

description:
We ordered delivery through yelp, and we really enjoyed our food. Most of the main dishes are between $8 and $13 and the portions are sizable. We ordered without rice and steamed some of our own at home, but I found that the rice was overkill in terms of total amount of food. 

The man who delivered our food was prompt and friendly, greeting me with a big smile.

Our only complaint was that we chose the "spicy" option (on a no-spice to extra-spicy scale) for Mongolian Beef, and it wasn't spicy at all. I'm not sure whether this was a mistake in the order or whether the dish is just generally less spicy than other dishes ordered at that level. My General Tso's Chicken was great at the spicy level, although I may step it up to extra spicy next time we order from here!
author: Olivia H.

description:
Just ordered Eat24 delivery from them for a work lunch. Prompt delivery (they were early) but they did forgot one of my items. They said they would come back with the missing item and they did...and gave me some cash back for the trouble. 

Great customer service on the restaurant's part and the food was tasty too. Lunch portion was generous - leaving enough for a second meal.

Would order from again.
author: Carolyn J.

description: This place was great! Went for lunch last week and the food was so fresh and hot! Orange chicken and sesame chicken was delicious! The lunch portions are HUGE and I felt like it was such a good deal for 7$! Also the cream cheese wontons we got as our appetizer were delicious!!!
author: Katie C.

description:
We picked it for delivery based on its high rating and although it was standard, it wasn't great. 
The pot stickers were good, as were the spring rolls. The pot stickers would have benefited from a specific pot sticker sauce, rather than normal soy sauce. 
The green beans were very spicy although I asked for mild. 
The walnut prawns were the most disappointing. Very obviously fried and the sauce was greasy. 
Delivery was fast and good.
author: Monika R.

description:
Food and wise this is a 4 star place, the food is delicious that I always finish everything I order and I mean clean the plate! Reason I don't give it 5 is that just like any other restaurants there where a few not so good dishes..and it can be a little bit on the greasy side, but that's what makes it great too!

This isn't your fine dinning so don't expect that, but expect quality taste! I been going here at least once a week since I started working in SF!
author: Alan T.

description:
Woah woah woah woah. Woah. San Fran has flame Chinese food? Indeed, this is the case. Elaine's Kitchen is some of the best Ive had. Even better than home.

I ordered delivery through yelp to the marriott. Yelp ordering rocks. It arrived in less time than it was anticipated. It arrived fresh and hot. 

The hot and sour soup was good. Just enough spice. 

The spring rolls were crispy and the dipping sauce was yummy.

The shrimp fried rice. Wow. This was my favorite by far. HUGE shrimp, just enough soy sauce as to not completely destroy the rice. No grease mess at the bottom of the container. 

Delicious, fresh Chinese in San Fran. Quick delivery.
author: Dan P.

description: I ordered 3 lunch dishes and they were all excellent. Large portions for the price. Sesame chicken was perfect - good quality meat and still crispy even though it took over an hour to arrive (because I ordered at noon). However two of the three plastic clamshell boxes they came in cracked and sauce leaked everywhere, so can't give it the 5 stars the food deserved.
author: Niki P.

description: Hands down favorite Chinese in the city. If it's a busy night might take a little bit, but worth the wait! I know Chinese can sometimes be a little sketchy and you want to make sure you're getting clean meat and I would definitely recommend Elaine's! :)
author: Manda P.

description:
Ordered house fried rice, mongolian beef, sesame chicken, and hot/sour soup.  All the dishes tasted good.  They were able to deliver to our hotel room within 30 min and didn't charge for delivery.  The lady on the phone was very nice as was the delivery person.  Very satisfied with our experience and would definitely order again.

edit:  for the mentally challenged, they cut open the sides of the delivery container to let the steam out- not because of broken containers...
author: JP C.

description: I first ordered from here about 3 months ago and the food was great. Sesame chicken was tasty and flavorful, sweet and sour chicken had a great sauce and I was extremely happy to have found my new Chinese food place. The quality has gone down steadily since then and the same meals I ordered the first time are now almost inedible. Last nights offerings were plain awful, the chicken was hard, heavily coated in flour and covered with thick, gluey, flavorless sauce. A shame, and the last time I waste my hard earned cash on them. My search continues for a CONSISTENTLY good Chinese restaurant.
author: terence r.

description:
Elaine's really hits the spot.  Yummy (greasy), yummy, greasy, yummy, fried, Chinese food.  Their General Tso's and Sesame Chicken is fantastic and the egg fried rice goes well with.  Just space these out a couple months so it doesn't kill you.  They also have a delicious eggplant that includes shrimp and a whole bunch of meats all in one.  (mmmm)

Really good service and polite delivery folks too.  This is for when I need a little comfort.
author: Praneeth W.

description:
Coming from Jackson and going up Broadway, be aware that this is uphill. It was so much easier going back down with food in your hand ready to eat. Thank goodness this restaurant accepts credit cards because most Asian restaurants don't.

Anyway, I ordered the lemon chicken lunch special here with fried rice and soup. This place was not heated, by the way. The door was open and it was January. Very chilly inside. The wait was ridiculously long as well. I waited about 15 minutes for my order.

Back to the food, the lemon chicken was amazing! It wasn't undercooked and it wasn't too crunchy. It was perfect cooking. The fried rice was flavorful as well. Just sprinkle some soy sauce over it tasted great. The soup, however, was all right. I didn't expect much but it was decent.
author: Aj C.

description: Ordered delivery and would say this is subpar Chinese unfortunately. Order the Chicken Chowmein, hot and sour soup and General Tso's Chicken...ended up throwing most of it away because it just tasted re-heated.
author: Brett W.

description:
Don't order from here. A 10% tip was added to my order without my consent. Wouldn't have been that big a deal if the food itself wasn't awful.

Oily food with low quality meat and dry mealy breading on fried items. By far the worst delivery experience I've had in SF.
author: Loren A.

description: Great Chinese food! Delivery was earlier than expected! The Crab Cheese puff was the best I've ever had, the Sesame Chicken was so delicious, the Mongolian beef was perfect. I highly recommend this place!
author: Xiujin Z.

description: We order delivery from here a fair amount. General tso's, beef and broccoli, wor wonton soup and house special eggplant are reoccurring. Tasty, reasonable, good as leftovers.
author: Evan M.

description: Nice little spot. Very casual, cozy and welcoming. The food here is super tasty. Ever since I moved to the area, this is my go-to when I'm craving Chinese food which is at least once a week. I usually go in but have gotten delivery a few times as well. Either way, the service is great. The shrimp chow mein is so yummy. The shrimp are always cooked perfectly. I also can't stop by without getting an order of the Shanghai pork steamed dumplings along with the spring rolls. I highly recommend this place. Go in and try something. You'll like it!
author: Anais B.

description:
I travelled from New York and I really want to try some traditional Chinese Food here. I ordered some food and picked up there. It's fast and clean enough. 
The food:
kung pao chicken dinner combo (comes with egg roll) - it was delicious
egg drop soup - also delicious
shrimp lo mein - lo mein was good, shrimp was so-so
pork fried rice - delicious
szechuan spicy wontons - not good, they were sweet and not so spicy
triple crown (tender white meat chicken, beef & jumbo shrimps blended with seasonal chinese vegetables. it is given personality by a brown sauce for epicures only) - not to shabby, but not as delicious as expected

I would totally order from them again. Great portions at great prices too.
author: Peter L.

description:
Ordered from here for about three years because delivery was fast, food is mediocre. Watch out for dumplings.
Tonight driver sat outside my doorman, high rise building for 15 minutes before he realized he should approach the guy doorman and ask to come up. Food was ice cold and order was wrong. Husband called and woman answering the phone not interested in "our problem"   
Last time here.
author: Mary O.

description:
Ok my husband ordered tonight and we have never ordered from here before.
Unfortunately, all the food was substandard. Specifically the wonton soup was watery and lacked flavor with mystery meat inside. My garlic broccoli had no garlic and the other 2 dishes were greasy with no flavor, a gungpow chicken and something with chicken and eggplant? It was $65 dollars worth of food and no fortune cookies or rice included. Save your money or just order from somewhere else. Sorry but one star for arriving on time.
author: Tara L.

description:
The food arrived hot but was the worst Chinese food I have ever had.  Ordered through eat24, rice, sesame chicken and vegetable delight.

Delivery arrived on time and driver was friendly.

The sesame chicken came with all white meat but over half of the "chicken" was just large fried pieces of batter in a sauce that was sickeningly sweet sauce with no flavor besides sugar.

The vegetables were actually perfectly cooked but the sauce, again, extremely sweet!  The vegetables were cooked in what tasted like thinned out oyster sauce with sugar added. 

Food was so gross that I actually ended up tossing it after combing through the batter for the slivers of meat that I ate along with the white rice (rice was fine).

The Yelp rating fooled me on this place, 4 out of 5?  No way unless I caught them on a really off night or people that eat here like really sugary Chinese food (and this is sugary by Americanized Chinese food standards, Panda Express has three Michelin stars compared to this place!).
author: Mailah G.

description:
Just ordered via Yelp/Eat24 and immediately after I ordered, I got a call from Elaine's asking me if I meant to order rice, as the entrees don't come with it. I didn't want to add on rice but I greatly appreciated the call and service! 

Food came quickly and was still nice and warm. And delicious, and spicy just like I wanted. Lots of flavor and didn't taste greasy or oily at all!
author: Sam S.

description: Elaine's is my favorite local Chinese take out restaurant to date! It also helps that they deliver so so quickly once you place the order--I've never waited more than 20 minutes once I call. We typically order every other weekend and definitely have our favorite entrees. The sesame chicken and broccoli with beef are probably the best meat entrees. However their chow Leon and rice options are great as well. I love that you can get shrimp, pork and chicken in the fried rice at no extra charge! Note that when you order a meat entree it does not come with a side of rice so you do have to order that separately. If you're looking for some appetizers to share I recommend the crab cream cheese puffs or the pork dumplings which we tend to alternate depending on the mood we're in. Bottom line you cannot go wrong here, check them out next time you're in the North Beach area!
author: Elise M.

description: We ordered takeout from Elaine's a few nights ago. The food was decent- the portion size was great, and I'm pretty sure they don't use MSG. The only thing is that we ordered it to be spicy, but we found that the food was not super flavorful, and it lacked salt. Kind of a bummer that we had to re-season the food once we got home with it, but overall pretty good. I might try another place next time for Chinese food because of that.
author: Priya B.

description: Great little Chinese joint. Nice lunch special. Quick friendly service. Definitely recommended.
author: Chris N.

description: I frequent this spot every know and then for lunch when I'm in the area. The staff is always polite and helpful. The food is always good and quick.  Overall, the food is solid and I would definitely return.
author: Dee S.

description: Dont get me wrong, the food was hot and delicious. It was sooooo loaded with MSG. Not a good idea to eat here if you have a sensitive tummy.
author: Sean H.

description: My favorite Chinese restaurant in SF. I love the spicy basil chicken here so much and the price is really cheap. By the way，I love the free soup （I don't know the name）and dumplings as well.
author: Siqi C.

description: Love their lunch meal. Would recommend them. Good amount of portion of food. Love their soup and wonton. I was quickly sat down and served right away. The food came out within 5-7 mins.
author: Tuong Q.

description: Misled by rating and reviews.  Inedible. Maybe not super greasy is about all u can say.  Horrible flavor.  Chow mein old rubbery noodles with a few slices of onion tossed in when they warmed it up for my meal. Super bummed.
author: Angie P.

description:
Ordered some late night Chinese delivery from here and it was delicious. I got the vegetarian chow mein, mo pao tofu, and mixed vegetable dishes with white rice. The food was delivered in a timely manner, it was still hot, and it really hit the spot. Definitely will do this again.

I also randomly got 2 lemons that looked like they were picked from someone's backyard put into my delivery bag. Not sure where those came from and why...
author: Lindsay L.

description: Ordered delivery. Quoted 45-60 min. Took 1.5 hours after we followed up multiple times. Ordered dumplings (arrived very cold) and chicken cashew (arrived without rice). Decent flavor but horrible delivery service.
author: Morgan G.

description: Did a home delivery. Food was ok. I have eaten better Chinese food. Good value for money though. They sent free soup with my order. If I could I would have given half a star more for it.
author: Vidya K.

description: Elaine's Kitchen is delicious. I started coming here through meal pal and ever since I always choose them whenever they have vegetarian options. They give good portion sizes. The food is always great. It is a nice cozy restaurant. I highly recommend it!
author: Gabriel T.

description: Dang this place has some awesome Chinese food! It's a small place tucked between other business a block from naked lunch. I came here with a friend for a late dinner and we really enjoyed our experience. I have never received so much food for so little money. Everything was super tasty!
author: Greg B.

description:
Ordered delivery which arrived early -- great! -- but lukewarm with some pieces being cold -- not so great :(

Entrees do not come with rice and you are not prompted to add it when you order. That's a showstopper for me. I've ordered plenty of Chinese food and never not had rice accompany my meal or at least been asked if I wanted to include it. But beyond all this the food itself was average. I'm perplexed at the 4-star rating; I've honestly had better at Pei Wei(PF Chang).
author: Destiny B.

description: Free Delivery via EAT24, minimum $15. F*ck yeah I'm ordering my lunch here. There are days when you forgot to bring lunch bc you're just so busy and hardly noticing the sun outside. You just want to eat at your desk and keep plowing til your brain says "2 + 5 = 8" but MS excel says "No, dumba$$!" You wanna play hard but want to save that shat for Friday night. So, you live like the cheapskate mole you are and order at Elaine's bc the money you'll save to nourish yourself today will be allotted to Advil and Pedialyte expenditures come Saturday morning.
author: Sheila C.

description: I really like this place. We always order for delivery and they are really nice while taking the order. They also deliver in a reasonable time. This is now our go-to for Chinese delivery.
author: Flor C.

description:
Had to attend a business meeting across the street, saw this place was open & got excited as I've been craving Chinese for awhile. We got the house chow mein, egg rolls, & sesame chicken. Everything was tasteful. The service was friendly, also fast. Needed to write a review to share how amazing the sesame chicken taste! Every bite had a perfect crunch to it, the sauce is indescribable. Must try.


TLDR; everything was good, the sesame chicken was outstanding!
author: Harvest H.

description: Both Broccoli Beef and Fried rice had old taste.  The meat used in the fried rice had a horrible taste.   Pushed it away.
author: Rosa Olivia R.

description: Please instruct your cooks the difference between cumin seed and caraway seed when making Cumin Beef. Pork fried rice is good though.
author: Louise J.

description: Best takeaway Chinese I've had! It only took them 35 minutes and they were calling me from the hotel lobby. We had sesame chicken and rice, spring rolls and crab app! All great!
author: Pamela M.

description: I love this restaurant. My friends invited me to the restaurant yesterday. It is soooooo good. I tried the Mongolian beef and Mapo tofu both of them are very delicious.
author: Ellen C.

description: One of my coworkers recommended Elaine's Kitchen several times, I finally decided to give it a try. I came here yesterday,  I ordered one String Bean Chicken and one steamed white rice. It took me only $11.40. The food was awesome , the waitress was friendly and attractive. The ambience was nice! A bit of American Style,  anyway I love it!
author: Kelsy L.

description:
Absolutely the worst ever Chinese delivery food. Arrived cold with 2 moldy oranges included. Food tasted rancid and slimy. I feel ill ! We threw the food away after a couple bites. $40 down the drain literally.

Now I get 2 calls from the restaurant within an hour of receiving the food and writing this review,  offering me a free dinner ....are you kidding me ? Then another call offering to give me my money back if I delete my review. 
Disgusting food and shocked Yelpers give it 4 stars....but after reading more reviews I see I am not alone. Others were equally disappointed and sickened. A
author: Mickey L.

description:
This place is solid, especially for delivery.  The reason why the plastic tops are cut out is because they don't want the steam to soften whatever is fried inside.

Everything is pretty decent, and they deliver at a late-ish hour.
author: Isa H.

description: Small and clean Chinese food joint not quite in the heart of Chinatown but fairly close. I love Chinese food in the sense that I basically love general tso's chicken, orange chicken, and/or sweet and sour chicken. I found this general tso's chicken to be delicious - just the right amount of sauce and crunch. Rice is extra but they give you healthy portions - overall 2 entrees, rice, and a drink 30 bucks with tip.
author: Julia P.

description: This is the smallest Chinese restaurant I have ever been in and the best. The food was great and service was just as good and friendly. We'll be back soon.
author: Alex G.

description:
Ordered takeout from Elaine's Kitchen tonight and I gotta say I was pretty happy with the results. I wanted something quick, walking distance from my office on Montgomery, and not crazy-expensive. As Elaine's seemed to meet all my basic requirements I pulled up their menu on Grubhub and gave them a shot.

Clearly, this place's bread & butter is takeout / delivery. When I rolled in I was amazed to see absolutely no one in the restaurant - literally, not a soul - yet no less than a half dozen orders waiting to be picked up or else set out for delivery. Fascinating.

And I must say, they do what they do and they do it pretty well. Getting the General Tso's was definitely a good move. As I'm the farthest thing of being a hard core fan of Asian Cuisine, I usually go with the General because you can always count on it being relatively filling and not overly complicated - at least when compared to other Chinese dishes. The pork fried rice I had was a little dry - but still generally to my liking - so I can't complain. 

All in all a very positive and seamless experience. Will definitely be adding these guys to the list of places I have on speed-dial for late nights during the week.
author: Brian S.

description: Ordered delivery here. It was promised between 45-60 minutes but came after 90 minutes and was cold. Despite being cold, the general tso's chicken was decent. The dumplings and chow mein however were very bland. Would not order from here again.
author: Dave R.

description: I have ordered here before and was satisfied with everything....However, this last time I ordered for delivery, I ordered and paid for it online, waited in the lobby of my building for the food so I wouldn't miss them and while sitting there received an email saying that my food had been delivered. I notified Yelp, they contacted the restaurant on my behalf and the delivery driver apparently was now heading home.  Long story short the delivery driver either said "fuck it" or you tried to rip me off. Either way, I won't be ordering from here ever again.
author: Kody H.

description: The food here is delicious! I was in town about a week ago visiting friends, happened to come across this place and am so glad I did. I initially came in for a quick bite but ended up ordering a bunch of stuff including the lemon chicken, pot stickers, hot and sour soup and the broccoli beef. The food is super affordable so why not, right? Anyway, everything was great, but the lemon chicken as well as the beef were my favorites. I even ended up getting food delivered two days later. Fast delivery btw. I'll be back.
author: Tatiana G.

description:
Ordered from Seamless on a night when R was working late and I was desperate for Chinese fast food. Elaine's Kitchen! Calling out to me by name!

After a quick scan of reviews and pictures, I ordered the shrimp with vegetables and stir-fried green beans with onions. The delivery came sooner than expected, and the food was pretty decent for Chinese takeout. Shrimp tasted fresh, were large, and not too salty. Vegetables in the shrimp dish were not overcooked, and reasonably seasoned. The green beans were a little overcooked, but there was a good quantity of it. Overall, pretty good for a night in of takeout and TV.
author: Elaine T.

description:
I love this place! I have only tried the delivery and they are really fast (within 45 minutes). 

I love the honey walnut chicken and the shrimp! 

The chow mein and the fried rice is always great. 

Also tried the crab and cheese wontons - yum!!!
author: Brittany G.

description:
Pretty decent place for vegetarian chinese delivery.
Ordered the egg rolls, ma po tofu, and fried rice. Portion sizes were fairly large. It was a bit greasy but pretty delicious. Will order again!
author: Aditya M.

description:
Went to San Francisco to help my son move into the Tower 737.  We were so hungry after the move we ordered in from Elaine's Kitchen.  The delivery person was fast and polite.  The food OMG, the food was delicious!
The Broccoli Beef was the best I've ever had.  The beef was fresh and had a hint of BBQ.  The Orange Chicken was not soggy at all!  It was just the right crispiness and the orange sauce was delicious.   The rest of the meal was fried rice and chow-mien which was fantastic.   
If you ever get a chance to get to Elaine's Kitchen in San Francisco you will not regret it!  Happy eating to you!
author: Kristy W.

description:
HOLY !@#$% 

Never been more let down by yelpers on a recommendation.

This place seems to be remodeled or new owner not sure, but use to be called Green Garden which didn't have a 4 star overall rating.

This might be the most disgusting 'chinese food' I've had in the city.

Ordered a chicken dish and beef chow mein.

The chicken upon first bite, that immediate taste of low quality or rotten chicken has entered your body.

I was starving so I tried eating a few more bites but then I decided it just wasn't worth the food poisoning.

The beef chowmein? ahhhhhhhhhhhhhh

I dont even order chowmein anymore, but I was feeling nostalgic.

It was literally spaghetti noodles, with no sort of seasoning or anything, topped with "beef" that looked like the rubber food restaurants leave out for demonstration. It literally had gray spots and a glossy rubber texture. That I could not even have a bite of.

My cat, who is always hungry and tries to sneak a bite of my food did not flinch.

For the first time after many many orders I tried getting my money back from EAT24, but their customer service kept breaking up. I gave up, but my friend, if you are about to order from 'Elaines' for the first time, at least I would feel better if I saved someone else from this poor excuse for "food". I have no idea how this place has a 4 overall star rating, they say the first 15 or so reviews of a business are 5 star automatically cuz of family. 

Elaine must have a huge family!
author: Belito L.

description:
Came into this restaurant was an unexpected discovery.
It's clean and tidy, not as the usual Chinese restaurant.
Also the food is tasty, though it's the American flavor, but really worth to try!
author: Jason Z.

description:
I order from here frequently and it is consistently excellent. Favorites are house special eggplant, general tso's chicken and dried tofu with beef. Don't think I could survive in SF without Elaine's! 

Usually order two dishes w 2 orders of rice (for 2) and devour it w half an order of rice leftover. They usually throw in two oranges for dessert- the perfect meal!
author: Lynne C.

description:
-standard chinese restaurant
-nothing will blow you away, but will satisfy you
-quick delivery
author: Derrick W.

description: Fried rice was not what we expected.  Seemed like steamed rice with peas and eggs. The house eggplant was flavorful. The orange chicken was decent but seemed like it was sitting for a while. It was a late night order.
author: Sheilina S.

description:
Amazing food. There must be two different cooks at this place because the last time I ordered it was just ok, I didn't plan to re-order.  But this time it was freaking AMAZING.  Best Fried Rice I've ever had, super crisp and fresh chicken and the Walnut Shrimp....I ordered on a whim wishing it didn't have walnuts, but I couldn't have been more wrong, such a perfect combo.

Best Chinese I've ever had with second cook, just middle of the rode with the first one
author: Brian C.

description: I made the mistake of ordering from here again despite my last review. I didn't realized until it arrived that it was the same place I just was ordering blindly ... completely my fault. The food arrived, much better than the last time to be honest. Though despite my forgetfulness of my cash tip, which I am able to add after the fact via eat24.com the delivery driver added it HIMSELF WITHOUT MY PERMISSION. Are you freaking kidding me? What a joke and embarrassment to this completely unprofessional disgusting excuse for a restaurant. It was only a 2$ tip, which I'm more than happy to provide ... AT MY DISCRETION. My fault for giving this place a second chance.
author: J A.

description:
BE CAREFUL WHEN ORDERING DELIVERY, DRIVER IS A BOLD FACE LIAR 
I Placed a delivery order
I provided instructions to call when downstairs BC MY DOOR BUZZER IS BROKEN
an hour passes and my food isn't here yet
I called and asked for eta, they said he was there but no one answered the door so he left. After asking to call when arrived and him not doing so, I told them I didn't want the food anymore, but they kept saying, "oh he'll come back," but I said no I don't want the food anymore. the chicken is more than likely cold and unsafe to eat. I Ordered new food from a Resturant close by. I got a call saying "I'm here with your food" I respond " are you with THAI CHI or ELAINE'S KITCHEN? " the guy said "YES THAI CHI" 
AS IT TURNS OUT HE WAS IN FACT THE DRIVERER FROM ELAINES AND HE GAVE ME THE COLDEST FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD. 
I CALLED BACK INSTANTLY TELLING THEM WHAT HAD JUST HAPPENED. WHATS FUNNY IS THEY KEPT SAYING SORRY SO SORRY MISUNDERSTANDING YEAH RIGHT! I spoke to the driver on the phone at the Resturant he quoted me that he would be back in my area in 15 min 
I set a timer for 15 min wait 30 still no show of the driver 
About an hour later (30 mins before they close) I called back to tell them that they close  in 30 min and if the driver is on his way 
The driver called me and told me he has lots of orders and 15 min is hard to do
I responded saying "15 min is the time frame you gave me so expected my money then, when can I expect my money?" He said "20 min " Finally he decides to show up 
THANKS ELAINES FOR RUINING MY NIGHT I SPENT MORE THAN 3 hours FUSTRATED AND UPSET AND BY THE TIME THE STUPID DRIVER SHOWED UP WITH NY MONEY EVERY RESTURANT WAS CLOSED
author: yoo s.

description: I almost never write a review, but I was just so pleasantly surprised at what a good experience we had with Elaine's kitchen. My SO and I just spent the entire day moving to SF and finally finished trekking back and forth from the east bay exhausted and hungry. I ordered from the bridge anticipating an hour wait but they were so fast they almost beat us. The food was delicious and there was more than enough for us both with one entree and chow mein. Definitely has become our go to Chinese food for the rest of our time here
author: Krystal Lauren S.

description:
Wanted something Asian so I went to a nearby Chinese restaurant in Broadway. I was with 4 friends, we ordered many dishes. Here's my rank:

1. Salmon Fried Rice : definitely recommended!!!! Super good fried rice, and had many salmon chunks with it. Comes with a large portion
2. Kung Pao Chicken: chicken was well cooked, seasoned well, although I kinda wished for more chicken chunks, there were so many cucumber :p
3. Mongolian Beef: super recommended!!! Tasted perfect and tender and it smelled sooooo good
4. Spring Rolls: standard appetizers, tasted good though although it was too oily for me. The best part was they were served hot, fresh out of the frying pan I guess

Overall the service was good and fast, food was OK. Definitely will come back for the Salmon Fried Rice!!
author: Annisa J.

description:
So the girlfriend and I were feeling lazy so we didn't go out for dinner and instead decided to order in for dinner. 

 We both are fans of Chinese food and after seeing the positive reviews on here we ordered two standard dishes. Orange chicken and General's chicken. Both are similar dishes and probably only differ with the sauce.  With that said it was all breading and what little chicken there was was super dry. Neither one of us finished half of our order. 

Very disappointed
author: Richard P.

description: Go to randy ho. Not worth the time to write a review. Delivery cold and slow. Food orders messed up. What else do you need to know?!
author: Tom O.

description:
Great Chinese street food.
Big portions.
Delivery was fast and efficient. Food was hot and fresh.
It's a go.
author: Joe C.

description:
Equivalent to Tai Chi or Country Sky if you've lived in other nearby neighborhoods.  Nice consistent food.  Chow mein tends to be a little bland (like they boiled everything with the noodles.)  

Sesame chicken is as good as Yan's.
author: Chris C.

description:
We ordered this food to be delivered to our hotel.  The food was yummy. They packed extra plates, utensils & napkins--super kind!!

They made a special soft tofu & broccoli dish for us--the kids loved every bite!
author: Miss L.

description:
@Geoff G. - this one is written just for you!

Meant to try this place for quite a while, small family run Chinese restaurant on Broadway strip...the menu was quite interesting from potstickers to double cheeseburgers!  Maybe that's why we never tried...  Fast forward, ownership & name changed - pics of food look decent, short walk from home & we were hungry made it the perfect choice.  

Still settling in w/ artwork to be hung.  Interior looks new - flooring to paint...clean but sparse.  Waitress friendly with favorite words "you bet!" to most requests: do you have chopsticks?  May I have a glass if water...

One laminated double sided menu - half of one page is lunch specials.  

We had:
Steamed Shanghai dumplings - $6.95 - you get 10 in a bamboo basket.  Ok but pretty sure it's the frozen ones from 'Ga Ga' you can find in Asian markets as I used to make them for my dad

Wor wonton - $6.95 - this is combo wonton - napa cabbage, beef, chicken, shrimp, BBQ pork, carrot.  Fail - tasteless.  

House special chow mein - $6.95 - I had my heart set on noodles...shortly after we placed the order, waitress came back to say "we are out if noodles!  How about fried rice?"  "umm, no.  What do you mean you are out if noodles?!?  Do you have fun 'fat rice noodle' or rice noodle 'thin ones'."  "No, we are busy w/ a lot of take out orders!"  Just when my blood is boiling, she returned to say "the chef will be able to take care of you".  That he did - noodle was great, best dish & one we will likely order for delivery.

20% off during Grand Opening so great deal! 

Saraicha is the only hot sauce.
author: Gloria H.

description:
I would give 3.5 if they offered that. I'm going to list why because I'm hungry:

1. Walnut shrimp had too much sugar but if I could tell under the sweetness it was good shrimp.
2. Noodles were soft as heck 
3. Too much cabbage in the chow mein
4. Fast delivery, they were 30m earlier than the estimate
author: Chessie C.

description: Pretty good. The General Tso's Chicken was very tasty. Didn't really care for the beef and broccoli, but that's just my taste. There wasn't anything wrong with it. The crab puffs (rangoons) were amazing. My least favorite part was that I waited an hour and a half to even get my food. You guys are walking distance from here! C'mon!
author: Cassandra C.

description:
The Wor Wonton soup was fantastic, and I loved that I got a free orange with my delivery.

The House Special Eggplant and Spicy Fried Rice were incredibly disappointing though. I ordered both "very spicy," and I wouldn't even consider either to be mild spicy. I don't even think there were any hot spices at all. The rice was also almost burnt.
author: Ryan H.

description: This place has the best Chinese food I have had in a while. I ordered delivery. I ordered potstickers, steamed rice, kung pao chicken, and hot and sour soup. The food was at my door in less then an hour. Everything was so good!!! Perfectly spicy, and perfectly flavored. The Hot and Sour was some of the best I have ever had. I loved the broth, and I really liked that they left out the black mushrooms. Normally I have to eat around them, as I don't like them, but that is just my personal opinion. I will be ordering again this week most definitely!
author: Kelli N.

description: Had the Mongolian Lunch special. The beef was good quality and it was prepared well. This is a solid choice for reliable Chinese American fare.
author: F K.

description:
Oh Yelp, how often you disappoint. 

Tons of shrimp in the shrimp w/ mixed vegetables dish. Too bad they were unappetizingly mushy and gooey. Hot and sour soup was more sour than I've ever had. And that's my go-to app... Ate two bites not wanting to waste a large order, but finally threw it out. 

Wanted to like this place because it's a block from my office but pass.
author: Alyssa Y.

description:
I ordered this place hungover after an eventful New Years Eve. I got the sesame chicken, spicy fried rice and spring rolls. When it arrived it was all very hot, but I found the chicken with holes in the lid and the sauce on the side. So I was a bit annoyed I had to do it myself, but I'm assuming the purpose was to keep the chicken crispy which is fine. 

The food quality was pretty good. Not greasy at all which is what I read was an issue. The only issue I have is it was delivery and the guy made me come all the way down to the street in the cold to pick up my order after I tipped 30%. Other than that, it was a good choice.
author: D O.

description:
Stopped in for lunch to go after the lines at nearby food trucks were too long. Worried, because the place was nearly empty, but I will definitely be back!

Fresh, not greasy, Chinese food - super cheap ($6 for lunch) & served fast & hot. Very impressed.
author: K S.

description: A great find! Stumbled upon this spot thanks to yelp. Food was delicious and fast and service was friendly. Prices are very reasonable-especially for the city!
author: Whitney S.

description: I ordered the chicken wings and fried fish and it's beyond greasy. The only thing I taste is grease. You can tell the grease they used hasn't been changed for awhile. I tried this place because of the reviews. I'm assuming Maybe the other dishes are better. I didn't enjoy my food
author: Crystal M.

description:
Excellent Chinese food at a good price. I've only done take-out, and it's always on time for pick up.  Each dish is $8-10 and, although I've only tried the veggie dishes (and everything has been great), my meat-eating friends say that it's "delicious."  General Tso's chicken gets a solid high five every time they go, and I really like their garlic broccoli.  The food isn't overly seasoned or oily.  

The place is always empty so I'm guessing that delivery is the bulk of their business.
author: Naomi P.

description:
This is an Authentic Chinese food restaurant with very limited wait time. Two thumbs up for an awesome delivery experience! From sitting down to get our first dish is within 5-10 mins. We went there around 5:30 to avoid the line.

Seating is relatively spacious, everyone is very happy in the restaurant. This place is fabulous. The environment is cozy and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I visited here last Saturday along with my wife and two of my friends. We ordered the Crispy Sesame Chicken with house fried rice on the side and the dry sautéed string beans. The flavour, presentation and texture was all 10/10. If you want to try some tasty Chinese dishes, this is a great place to hit.
Mesmerized by the taste my wife wanted to try some more and so we ordered spicy basil chicken and dried tofu chicken. Spice was right on the medium spice order of spicy basil chicken and the dried tofu chicken was perfectly savoury. 
The food was served hot and perfect. The staffs were really honest, admirable and professional.
