LET ME TELL YOU: my wife forgot her wallet under the table (it had slipped out of her purse). 2 hours after leaving the restaurant, she noticed it was gone and remembered the last place she had it. We called them, they said they had it - and they did. NOTHING was missing from it: she had plenty of cash & cards inside that could've been taken with no accountability. But no, they had it waiting for her.
Definitely loved the way they are and so, I thought of ordering them for home delivery. This was the first time that I've ever eaten Chinese take-out. Yes you read that correctly...I've had my fair share of Chinese food in my day (both good and bad) but, my family never gets it as take-out. So I was a little skeptical about how well Chinese food tastes when its been delivered.

We ordered a variety of items (they have literally like a hundred menu items to choose from) and the portion sizes were pretty big. I would highly recommend ordering the Shanghai Pork Steamed Dumplings, mongolian beef, and potstickers.

I'd definitely order take-out from them again, and I would recommend it as long as you are careful about what you order! Check out the lunch specials for a great deal!

Overall, I loved this placed on all my encounters with them. Definitely a place to visit again and again.
author: Matin G.

description: Very quick delivery, kind service, and delicious food! Visiting from NC and choose this restaurant for Chinese.
author: Lila C.

description:
This place recently opened within the past few months, and I think they have room for improvement, but the food and service are decent. I ordered mapo tofu ($6.95) and steamed white rice ($1.50). The mapo tofu has lots of diced garlic chunks, carrots, and peas... not my favorite combination of ingredients in mapo tofu, but I liked its level of spiciness.

They also had a special where you can get a free order of hot and sour soup or crab cheese puffs, so I got the hot and sour soup. It was good! Overall the Chinese food here is not outstanding, but if I am conveniently nearby, I would order from Elaine's Kitchen again.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Increasing my rating to four stars. We have now ordered several times from Elaine's kitchen and the food has been consistently good. It's our go-to Chinese delivery place from now on.
author: EG P.

description: The store service also is pretty good, health is also very clean, environment is very comfortable, it is a good site for.Go here at least a couple of times a month for dinner.  $6.50 for awesome mongolian beef and white rice with complimentary soup and egg roll.  quick serivce,very much food and good price.  also have tried the orange chicken/generals chicken type dish which was good.
author: Kitty L.

description: I bring such disappointing news for Elaine's Kitchen. I ordered again since the food wasn't bad the last time I ordered in February. Plus they changed their delivery system, thinking maybe, now they are using Eat24 delivery maybe they'll be on time. Yes, delivery was faster than the last time but the food has gone down hill. Our egg fried rice was burnt. I mean who burns fried rice?!?!  The General Taos Chicken was such a sad affair. It was hard and doughy chewy. Deep *sigh* I guess, I must look somewhere else to order Chinese food and rely on Yelp! Hopefully, in the future, I'll be able to find good Chinese food that deliveries within an hour.
author: Kathy T.

description: Ordered from eat24.com, and it arrived within 30-45 minutes, which wasn't horrible. My boyfriend ordered orange chicken which was decent, and I ordered hot and sour soup. It was awful! It was luke warm, way too sour, and smelled rancid. I usually love hot and sour soup, so I figured it would be a safe choice. Not worth the money.
author: Megan F.

description:
Hmm...not bad! Just ate here today for a birthday lunch for a coworker, who had wanted Chinese food. We sometimes order lunches from here for our company so we decided to try out this place. The restaurant is located on Broadway past all the clubs and can be a little hard to spot, especially with the construction that is currently taking place right on top of the restaurant. The inside is pretty small but looks nice and modern! There were a lot of items on the lunch menu, which I really appreciate because I feel like lunch menus these days have such limited choices. I decided to go with the salt and pepper fish fillet. 

Before our entrees arrived, everyone got hot and sour soup and a fried cream cheese wonton as well, which are included with our lunch specials. Nice! The hot and sour soup was tasty and not too spicy as some can be. The cream cheese wonton had a good crispiness to it and the filling inside was pretty good. When all of our entrees came, they all looked like they gave a good decent amount of food. I was relieved to see that my fish fillet wasn't just all batter. The fish tasted fresh and was good with the peppers that it came with. My entree also came with white rice. So for the price, quality of the food, and good service, I think this is a great little gem to try!
author: Mary C.

description: It's such a great place to have a quick dinner with friends or family , even multiple times a week. They offer quick and reliable delivery service too. Glad to have them around !
author: Shirley G.

description: Worst Chinese delivery food I ever had!! Almost threw everything I ordered!! Waste of money
author: Manuel T.

description: Elaine's is awesome. I know this sounds crazy, but even with Chinatown like next door to North Beach it's really hard to find good Chinese food that isn't too greasy. But my boyfriend and I have gone back to Elaine's again and again because it's consistently delicious. Our staple items are the cashew chicken, spring rolls, wonton soup, and chicken fried rice. But we've tried a lot of others and love everything we branch out to.
author: Kathleen C.

description:
We opted to Elaine's as a last resort when the average wait time at every restaurant around our hotel was at least 90 minutes. Don't really know much about dining culture in SF area, but we thought the delivery time of 1 hour was a bit excessive at almost 9pm, but it was our only option with kids already knocked out in the room.

The lady that was taking the order was patient and courteous. She helped me get the order in. When I realized it was almost $55 (for 2 of us, but we don't blame them, we ordered like 5 things), I tried to cancel 1 of the items, but the lady told me she already processed the card.... bullshit, she couldn't possibly have charged the card within 10 seconds of telling me the total. It was really whatevers at that point and I didn't really want to fight it as we were starved. 

The delivery guy showed up after promised 1 hour. 

Fried rice was decent, but kind of had that Viet seasoning taste, not straight Chinese. It was good enough. Chowmein was super blend and just tasted like oil and cabbage. Other chicken/beef items were not great but not bad either... pretty standard greasy Chinese takeout. We were so hungry and just ate up our food without complaining, but honestly I felt like panda express had better quality food. I would've had probably given them 2 stars for food alone, but 3 for convenience factor in the busy Union Square area.
author: David L.

description: I ordered the sesame chicken (delivery). It tasted fine, but there was too much breading and often just crispy bits with no chicken. Very sweet. My stomach did not thank me afterwards.
author: Ryan B.

description:
My first time here! Got the 
Mongolian Beef
WOR Wanton Soup
Tastes amazing! 
Great flaver!
Quality meats!
The best thing about this place is the price !$$$
I'm very picky about my Chinese food because its my favorite food. 
Definitely coming back
author: Roman J.

description:
Delivery - 20 min late (80min total). Small portion entree (lemon chicken) that was soggy, sickeningly sweet but not flavorful and served over lettuce (which just makes things taste weird IMO). Crab Rangoon/cheese puffs were decent but not special, and I received pretty average store-bought sweet & sour sauce (as requested) for them. Steamed rice was fine.

Definitely would not order again... For $20 (twice the price of most my meals), I received like 40% less food than other places AND it didn't taste very good/was low quality AND it was late (don't tell customers 60min if you need 80!).

Very disappointed considering this is a 4-star restaurant. Did I just get super unlucky or do they have fake reviews ...?
author: Alex S.

description: Delicious, quick delivery, and my girlfriend craves the shrimp fried rice.
author: Robert A.

description: This is my one of favorite restaurants. The last time i ordered food at last mins (close at 10:00 and i ordered at 9:50) and Elaine (the owner) still let me order the food and not hurried me (good customer service). I ordered Mongolian beef and general tao's chicken and they were just fresh and hot.  The chicken was so crispy and the sauce was just right for chicken. I also ordered Mongolian beef for my roommate. My roommate said about tender beef and hot sauce. He really likes the combination of onion, beef, and hot sauce of Mongolian beef from the restaurant. Every time he asked me if i go to Elaine's kitchen, i must bring it for him. I highly recommend the restaurant to everyone.
author: Peter S.

description: Finally found my go-to Chinese food delivery place. Elaine's is delicious and our food has always been delivered in under an hour, which is a feat for SF food delivery. We have ordered delivery from here 3 different times now and not only is it quick, it arrives hot and without anything dishes being incorrect or missing which is another feat for delivery around here. The General Tso's chicken is extra delicious if you order it spicy, and the crab cream cheese wontons are SO yummy. I'm also a fan of the fried rice. I know fried rice is a basic dish, but Elaine's gets it right. I also really value the coupons that Elaine's has on Eat24 and Grubhub. The only criticism I have is that the ma po tofu was not a traditional recipe at all and it was actually pretty unappetizing (there was like... clumps of congealed sauce). Everything else we have tried has been good though!
author: Anna J.

description: Food was delicious, delivery was free with reasonable minimum order ($15). Would definitely order again!
author: Michelle A.

description: Ordered delivery for a night in at the hotel. Food came when expected and was fresh, hot, and delicious!
author: Travis D.

description: I wish I could give 3.5 stars but I think this place is closer to 4.  Elaine's is my go to Chinese delivery place.  The food is good quality and definitely the best option I have tried in my neighborhood.  The Crab cheese puffs are a little different with a more substantial wonton and more seasoning than a typical restaurant.  The sesame chicken is my favorite but all the entrees we have ordered are good.  You do have to order rice separately and delivery can take more than an hour if they are busy.
author: Harry C.

description:
Seafood chow mien stirred with extra soy sauce.
Beef chow mien stirred with extra soy sauce.
Hot&sour soup bowls are my usuals :-)

There food is actually pretty damn delicious but a little bit pricy then lately I noticed that the food portion itself is a lot so price itself is fair.  
I tried the Mongolian beef at many other restaurants and never liked it but the one that  Green Gardens make was really good I mean its not the authentic Mongolian beef that we make it back home but I liked it so far. Plus its a Family  business and they are really friendly too.
author: Namuna B.

description: We are visiting from out of town and didn't feel like going out after a long eventful day. We decided to order Chinese food. Free delivery, yummy appetizers, and the chicken dishes we had were also delicious. The only downside we had was that they didn't give us any rice. We are used to getting white rice when you order an entree. Other than that it was great. I would order again and just request rice next time.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Elaine's Kitchen is amazing!!!! I have never been so impressed and pleasantly surprised by a meal. I implore you to experience this gastronomic revelation. 

Have you ever eaten Chinese food that left you feeling lethargic and full of self-loathing? General Tso's chicken that looks more like a MSG jello than actual food? General Tso's chicken that you can't figure out what part of the chicken you're eating?

Elaine's is the antithesis of the aforementioned questions. The General Tso's was lightly breaded, white meat chicken in a lite, flavorful ginger sauce. The potstickers were gracefully crafted with fresh ingredients.
author: Roland C.

description: The delivery sometimes takes a while, but the drivers are normally very nice/polite and the food tastes great! I would suggest their sesame chicken. Also, for some reason they almost always give an orange, which I have no complaints about ;)
author: Richard L.

description: We had our meal delivered, it arrived fast and hot. Everything we ordered was delicious-Orange chicken, chow neon, dumplings. Highly recommend
author: E W.

description:
I ordered three dishes with appetizer and soup for a delivery to my hotel.  It arrived in 50mins, which was very late for a restaurant less than a mile away.  Also, when I took it up to the room, I realized there was no rice.  When I called the restaurant they said I had to order the rice separately. They just said sorry.  Unheard of! I didn't want to order the rice and wait another 50 mins so we are without the rice.  

However the food was a different story. Some of the dishes were very bland, others way too salty. The quality of the food was horrible. I would not go there again.  Beware!
author: Brian J.

description: soo yummy! ordered for delivery and it got here in 30 minutes on a friday night. everything was perfect and flavorful. none of the crispy fried items were soggy i feel like thats a problem with a lot of deliveries but this place killed it. will definitely be back.
author: Nicolette T.

description: Take out here was fabulous. We had the fried rice and basil chicken, there was so much flavor and freshness. Reasonably priced and quick delivery. We will definitely order again.
author: Andy A.

description:
Located on Broadway Street, it's located near work so this is a new lunch spot for me! My co-worker has been here before, so of course if someone wants to go back, you know it's good.

It's a cute little restaurant, there's about 7-8 tables and we got greeted/seated right away. They pretty much have a standard Chinese food menu so if you've had Chinese food before it's easy to decide. Go for their lunch specials! 

Here are the things that will make me come back:

1) Sweet & Sour Soup - brought out right away & it's yummy!
2) Free Crab Cheese Puffs - the best things in life are FREE!
3) Tea - just something about their tea, oh, & they are generous with refills!
4) House Special Eggplant - perfect "hot" factor and tasty
5) Fried Rice - de-freakin'-licious!

Also, between the two of us, the bill was around $16 bucks for an in-restaurant meal. Yeah! What is that normally? 1 fancy salad?!?  Haha. Can't beat that.
author: Sammie T.

description: Good delivery , liked the orange chicken, had candied orange slivers on it. The fried rice had shrimp in it which wasn't my bag. They gave us free hot sour soup, and threw in three free oranges. I will order here again.
author: Meghan O.

description: Delicious Chinese food for a quick service restaurant. You know you're getting something cheap, quick, and greasy, but you pay for what you get.
author: Alexandra B.

description:
I tried General Tso's Chicken and Cheese Crab Rangoons. 

Food was Americanized in the stereotypical cheap bland manner, like a more expensive version of Panda Express. I've had amazing artistically Americanized Chinese food and this is not one of them. 

It would be a good choice if the food were dirt cheap, but it actually costs as much as many great-tasting alternatives in San Francisco.
author: Max L.

description:
Tried it out on week 2 - probably a mistake on my part.  BUT...

Service was friendly and earnest, yet fraught with errors. Literally had 4 incorrect plates show up - for a party of two. Lots of apologies, but also resulted in a very long lunch, exactly the opposite of why we tried it out!

General tso chicken was a big disappointment- and I consider it a staple/easy dish. Just didn't have any spice or tanginess to offset the sweet.  Huge bummer.

Soup dumplings were a disaster. Must avoid.

Will try again in a few months - maybe...
author: Jeremy T.

description:
- very bland won ton soup
- walnut prawns had no sauce
- chow mein was average

not coming here again.
author: Boris C.

description: Great service, decent chinese food. Very tasty crispy honey walnut prawn
author: Carlos V.

description:
Just had dinner here tonight and decided it was something to write home about (literally)! I don't write reviews often, but made an exception for Green Garden (now called Elaine's Cafe?), as the owners of this restaurant are really sweet and genuinely care about making their food and dining experience great--plus the food is SOLID! 

I came here with some friends who have been frequenting this place since they were high schoolers back in 2004, and they said the food has stayed consistently delicious. They were definitely right!

We shared the:
- Mongolian beef: As the others say, you must get this!!! With a savory, slightly sweet sauce and tender beef, this dish hits the spot
- Spicy cod filets: Awesomeee, and probably my fave. Fish was lightly fried and tossed in a delicious tangy sauce, but was not too sweet
- Pork potstickers: Huge potstickers with a lot of meat, and lightly fried but not greasy
- Kung pao chicken: This was okay; not bad, but not great either
- Shrimp chao mein: Large succulent shrimp, sauteed with thick, soft noodles and some veggies! Solid, but also what you would expect 
- Hot & sour soup, and crab cream cheese puffs: These came free with our meal and were yummy!

Unlike many other Chinese places, they do NOT use a ton of oil in their cooking, and the restaurant is SUPER clean and orderly (say what!!!). Also, I appreciate that the vegetables in their dishes taste fresh and crisp, and the owners always bring out the food with humble smiles. Service is great, and prices are really reasonable! Dinner entrees average $8-9 for chicken/beef, and $10-11 for seafood, and portions are not stingy. 

Overall, if you want to support a good local business and also satisfy your hankering for Chinese food (without walking away with a stomach ache or empty wallet), come here!!
author: Celia M.

description: Ordered delivery for dinner from here recently and it was pretty good! Nice and spicy with good flavors. The general tso's and eggplant/garlic dish were my favorites. I wish they had more noodles other than just boring chow mein, but other than that this spot is solid. Definitely greasy though, tummies be warned!
author: Natasha F.

description:
I had a craving for dumplings and being temporarily housebound, couldn't get out to one of my favorite restaurants.  I looked up some on Delivery.com and came up with Elaine's.
I ordered two different dumplings and won ton soup.  All three dishes were amazing.  Some of the best chinese food I've ever had.  The dumplings were light and flavorful.  The wonton soup had a clean tasting broth chocked full of fresh fish and meats.  I can't wait to go there and try some other dishes.  Judging from the reviews, it seems they do some things better than others.
I was going to order the chicken salad but decided against it when they gave a choice of western salad dressings.  Not sure what that's about but will ask when I go.
author: Jane G.

description:
Ordered through Eat24 with expected delivery time of 30-45 minutes.  After an hour and a half I called.  The woman who answered was friendly enough and said she'd call the driver.  10 minutes later he arrives yelling at me that he couldn't find the place (even though he had my number),  shoves the bag in my hand and storms off.
Fine at least we got our bland food.  The veggie chow mein had zero flavor.  The sesame chicken was so heavily deep fried you could barely taste the chicken.
author: Alex D.

description:
Very fast delivery. Good came in half the time estimated. 
Free orange!
I purchased the fried tofu and chicken stir fry. Didn't come with rice. Delivery guy was very nice.
author: Mimi W.

description: Not sure about the food, but their delivery driver almost crashed into my girlfriend's car at a stop light.
author: Aaron R.

description: I honestly can't believe there are good reviews for this food.  We ordered delivery from here, and trust me that it wasn't that fact that the food was not good.  Nothing had any flavor at all - from the soups (egg flower, wonton, and hot & sour) to the main dishes (string bean chicken and the broccoli beef).  The broccoli beef is marked as spicy on the menu, but it was nothing close to even being mild (even though I indicated spicy on the order from the dropdown box).  The only flavor was extremely bland sauce and a tiny hint of garlic.  Also, they didn't include any rice, and it wasn't obvious on the menu that it would need to be ordered as an extra.  The only thing this place did ok with was the crab cheese poofs, but even that was just average.  How about if they skip putting random oranges in the delivery bag and just focus on making the food better.
author: Dave B.

description: Best delivery Chinese food for the price in the neighborhood! Big fan of the sesame chicken, and it's only 9.95
author: Nazir K.

description:
In comparison to what I've tried so far for Chinese take-away, I was pretty darned happy with this place. The prices are very reasonable because apparently just north of Broadway is expensive, just south of Broadway is expensive, but Broadway isn't? Sure.

More importantly, these folks do actually understand the meaning of gluten-free -- as in, they actually wok'ed me up some orange chicken without the breading, and it made me very happy. The veggies were fresh enough (not frozen or canned so it would seem), and I didn't wake up feeling like I had just eaten a chunk of the Great Wall the next day.

Service was quick and friendly, although being take-away, I didn't get the full experience. Most importantly, I really do love Cantonese-American food, and since so many places either can't translate "gluten" or just don't know what it means, this is probably my go-to place until something better comes along.

Extra points (but not stars) are earned for being a family business -- perhaps not unique to Chinatown -- but a dwindling percentage of the overall West Bay food scene.
author: Amy P.

description: My go-to takeout place! I ordered shrimp fried rice & the house special eggplant with chicken twice and both times it was consistently delicious.  Obviously not any gourmet Chinese takeout here but I really liked the quality of ingredients (huge pieces of shrimps) and flavors. Not to mention, their delivery and service is great. 1st delivery came right within 40 mins. 2nd time I ordered it, the rainy weather factored into the delay but when I called in for the status, the woman who answered called the driver to give me an accurate eta which rarely happens with delivery!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Love this place. It is consistently solid, quick delivery- chicken wings are the best around! I love the chow mein- and the garlic broccoli is to die for. Delivery is always quick (like 45 mins), and it's SO CHeAP!!! Love love love!!!
author: J W.

description:
I am a Chinese who have spent 20 years growing up in China and am a regular consumer of Chinese food. They have good Chinese food and the taste is really. The house fried rice is made with various meat and vegetables and tastes real good (and they are doing it the old way because among the three I had one of them is saltier than the others). Their Chow Mein is very good too, the slightly over-oily noodles reminds me exactly what I used to have back in China. I highly recommend the tofu chicken, general tso's chicken and broccoli beef, which I had for three different meals. These dishes have a very good taste and texture and have a special aroma that is generally lacking in some other Chinese restaurants. The food looks also healthier as they are less starchy and you can easily tell that the vegetables they use are very fresh.
Highly recommended. And they give some oranges if you order for delivery!
author: Shuang L.

description:
Legit Chinese takeout. 

The honey walnut prawns had huge prawns in them. I loved that it was not drowned in a mayo dressing. The chicken wings were crispy and perfectly seasoned. 

Delivery took about an hour but I think most places take about the same time. Will definitely order from here again.
author: Maida C.

description:
This place is a small hole in the wall full of tasty quick Chinese dishes. I had the General Tsao's Chicken, Mongolian Beef, and Hot and Sour Soup. All ordered at Medium spice. But to my taste buds medium seemed mild. 
The Generals Chicken was perfectly crispy, and when you bite into a sweet tangy chunk you see beautiful white meat chicken staring back at you.
The Mongolian Beef was savory and covered in onions both white and green. Sadly the dish lacked those crunchy little rice noodles but otherwise the balance is good enough to dive into.
The Hot and Sour Soup had a slightly beefy taste and is perfectly thick and tart.
I ordered for pick up and Elaine herself called 10 minutes early to let me know delishiousness was ready.
author: Sean C.

description:
Food was above average, not too corn-starchy, meat was high quality, not overcooked. Portions are not huge, but they are still enough for two people at least.

Delivery was quick, will definitely order again.
author: dutchy s.

description: Bro, I'm not sure we are eating at the same place lol. Well, if we are avoid the chicken chow mein, "spicy" and dry General tso, and the dumplings. I'm sad I got hyped about this food which took an hour forty-five to get to me. And no chop sticks or sweet and spice sauce... Too sad
author: Ari M.

description:
Seriously delicious General Tso's chicken, Lemongrass chicken and crab cheese puffs. This is coming from someone who is not a big fan of chinese food. 
~ Quality food that you can taste is made with care. 
~ The employees are so sweet. 
~ Cute, clean & humble little place with a nice atmosphere. 
To everyone at Elaine's, great job & thanks for a great experience!
author: Suki M.

description: Elaine's have really good set of food! Their orange chicken is a must-taste! Plus, Elaine (the owner of this resto) is really nice, even if it will close in 5 minutes, they still will deliver for you!
author: Bernadeth Regine A.

description:
We were a group of 6 adults and 5 kids which two of them were toddlers and the service was amazing. The owners were very attentive and they don't have high chairs but we made it work. We were a very loud group and I was amazed on how nice they were. 

Also the food was amazing!!! We got the walnut shrimp, orange chicken, chicken noodles, mango-lain beef, fried rice with shrimp and fried rice with chicken... Yummy! So fresh and amazing. I'm glad we came here.
author: Jacqueline O.

description: Best chinese food in san francisco (Indians will love the taste) - Ask for extra spicy in all the dishes you order *_*
author: Aboli G.

description: Delicious food, super-fast delivery. Sesame chicken, vegetable delight, sautéed string beans, shrimp with cashew and celery - all amazingly tasty, in good quantity, delivered hot.
author: Steven A.
Tony W.

description: really, really great. i mean, really fresh, delicately spiced, hot, FAST and just amazingly, surprisingly delicious. I expect a lot from delivery services and from restaurants and Elaine's didn't disappoint. Will definitely be ordering again!
author: Katya B.

description: Love it! Every time I come to SF I must stop by here! Sesame chicken is my dish of choice.
author: Edward L.

description: I love this place, took us living in North beach/Chinatown 5 years to find a great Chinese restaurant and turned out it's only a few blocks away from us!! I think they are small family owned and I have actually gotten deliveries from young girls(their kids, I assume while the parents waited in the car..) The food always came fast and super fresh! Speaking of fresh, I read a review from someone complaining about "broken" packaging, ummmm those are NOT broken, they have open holes on top of the plastic lid to keep the fried dishes from getting soft! Only down side, they do not offer pork dishes...;(
author: Ladywolf M.

description:
3 nights in a row since I first discovered this place.  My old take-out favorite should be worried...

I love the eggplant house special and ma po tofu.  The chicken with string beans-not so much.  

They definitely use baking soda to tenderize their meat.  However, I am willing to overlook that given the sauce and flavoring are spot on.
author: Joyce P.

description: Elaine, all I can say is thank you. I've never gotten the pleasure of meeting this incredibly talented woman, but her kitchen is close to my heart. My woman and I placed an Elaine's order for delivery and our expectations were fully exceeded. Every item ordered took us straight to FLAVORTOWN! Finding this place has been both a blessing and a curse (only for my waistline).
author: Lindsey H.

description:
Review of delivery from Green Garden Restaurant.

Easy to order via http://eat24hours.com/

Delivery - The order was placed at 1:40 PM.  The order was delivered at 2:29 OM.  Delivery time of 49 minutes.  It was within the estimated 45 to 60 minutes.  However, there are places with quicker delivery.  Delivery is free.

Minimum Order - Delivery minimum is relatively high ($20).

Mongolian Beef - The vegetables were over cooked.  The meat was tender and had nice flavor but did needed more zip.  They did not include the side of hot sauce I requested.  The portions were relatively large.

http://tinyurl.com/6aln55r

http://tinyurl.com/6h2td9l

General's Chicken - It had no crunch.  The chicken was tender.  This dish was extremely bland.  The broccoli was extremely overcooked.  Luckily, I do not really eat cooked broccoli.

http://tinyurl.com/6bd3mnj

Rice - The rice was well-cooked.

Packing - The food was neatly packed into easy to reseal plastic containers.  There was some very minor leakage.

Pricing - Their prices are a bit on the high side.  They do have lunch specials but these are only available on weekdays.

Soft Drink 3 
$1.50 
Steamed Rice 2 
$1.50
Mongolian Beef 1 
$8.95 How Spicy?: Hot
Instructions: Side of hot sauce please
General Tsao Chicken 1 
$9.95 How Spicy?: Hot

Subtotal: $26.40 Discount
Tax: $2.51 Delivery Charge: Free !
Total:   $28.91 

Fortune Cookie - They did not include fortune cookies.  Chinese food without fortune cookies is like Christmas without Santa Claus.

Overall - The food was very average.  The prices are slightly high.  Delivery was a little on the long side.  No fortune cookies.  No hot sauce.  There are many better all around options for Chinese food delivery.  But, in a pinch, it will do.  There are certainly options that are not as good.
author: Mark D.

description: Ordered takeout and it was very solid.  General Tso chicken, bbq pork chow mein and crab puffs.  Everything was great, reasonably priced and fast delivery.  Very worthy of 4 stars.
author: Ryan M.

description: I was not sure what expect when I walked in and no one was inside, usually a bad sign. But I had faith and took something to go, probably like most people do and found the food was really good! So I'm giving 5 stars to balance out all those one star people who probably need to chill out and realize the world doesn't revolve around them.
author: Larisa M.

description: Yummy dried fried string beans and crispy walnut prawns! delivery was quick, and the serving sizes are great for the price.
author: Color C.

description: Was looking for a new Chinese delivery place and this was pretty good! Took about 40 minutes from the time I ordered on Yelp till it got to us in Soma. It's not authentic Chinese food, but it hits the spot. The general tso's chicken was still crispy by the time it got to us. The eggplant and tofu had a little too much oil, but it tasted really good.  The pot stickers are cooked right! Many places deep fry them but they actually pan fried them, yay! The sauce is just the pre-packaged stuff, so it would have been better if there was some homemade dumpling sauce. This will be my future go to delivery for Americanized Chinese food!
author: Kimberly L.

description: Tried Elaine's on a whim today through eat24, it was surprisingly good! I recommend it, food tasted clean of msg. Yay!
author: michelle z.

description: I really like Elaine's. The food is good, very reasonably priced and the staff is very friendly. One of my favorite lunch spots.
author: Russ M.

description: super nice service and the food is fast and tasty with big quantity! highly recommend it!
author: Xi C.

description: Everything sounded great from the beginning... Great price, delivery, only 7 minutes away. We placed an order over the phone and they told us it would be 30-45 minutes. It was 2 hours! Not exaggerating... Literally. Two hours. Go somewhere else!
author: Riley C.

description: One of my favorites for Eat24 delivery. They're always prompt and the food is consistently good. Without fail, we order the General Tso's and Broccoli Beef - both excellent over rice. I have picked up in restaurant as well and it looked like a nice spot, but the place was empty save for a number of delivery orders waiting to go out. It seems like they're focused heavily on delivery at this point, and for that I highly recommend.
author: Taylor B.

description:
I ordered the orange chicken. Best I've had in a long time. Always love the small touch of frying grated orange peel with the chicken. Companion 1 ordered Hunan chicken spicy. Companion 2 ordered Hunan mild. Definite difference. Both appreciated the effort. Companion 3 ordered sweet n sour chicken, also enjoyed it.

Normal order of egg rolls comes with 3 but waitress was nice and brought us 4 (number in our party).

Great little Chinatown spot. Will definitely be back.
author: Curtis K.

description:
I owe it to you Yelpers to be honest about this place regardless of the fact  there is a Chinese family simultaneously living inside the restaurant watching Little Mermaid on the TV atop an ice cream refrigerator. Mom in the back screaming for an entire 43 minutes STRAIGHT! I shit you not. Her stamina to be able to continue that long is simply amazing. 

So I ordered and was told to come back in 20 minutes. I came back to p/u and walked up the where I thought I would be able to pay and the man(Father) said it would be just a couple more minutes. So I sat down at a table not occupied by one of the kids. 2 more minutes actually ended up being 23 more minutes in what felt like the middle of this families living room as I was the only customer there. There was a young Chinese boy fiddling with his cell phone, a 3-4 year old watching TV, a teen girl on her laptop. All this on the tables for customers. And of course the screaming Mother in the back in Chinese...no subtitles.

The environment was not at all welcoming as I felt like I was intruding on a family in there home. This is the WORST atmosphere I have ever encountered. 

OK it's not all bad though. The food was really tasty. I got the scallops with chicken fried rice. Now about the scallops, yeah I know what they are supposed to look like and these scallops where sliced into thirds and then covered up into balls which were then fried. I was not too happy to see the cheapness of the family on the scallops. 

Bottom line: The food gets 4 stars. The atmosphere gets 0. Averaged out to 2 stars. 
To eat here the smart way my advice would be to CALL AHEAD for take-out only and pick up after doubling what they say pick up time is.
author: Richard L.

description: The food tastes good. However, I ordered for delivery and when my food was already half an hour late I called the restaurant. They didn't care at all, and only told me that the delivery driver had left 20-30 minutes prior (so, basically when I was already supposed to have it by). The food was all cold when I got it and the packaging on my chicken dish was broken. This restaurant is getting two stars because the food is really good, otherwise it would get zero stars for the service.
author: Ally K.

description: I tried Elaine's tonight for the first time...quite pleased! Everything was delicious! Delivery was fast and the food was hot. I'll be back!
author: Kim M.

description: Pretty awful honestly... The lemon chicken and general Tso's chicken both were heavily deep fried with almost no chicken at all (there were legitimately pieces of just fried batter with nothing in them...). The Kung pao chicken had about 4 small pieces of chicken and that was it... The dumplings were a bit suspect in flavor... The gyoza was about the only decent thing we received. Probably won't ever order from here again...
author: Frank P.

description: I had walnut shrimp. It was delicious!  My two other guests enjoyed their meal equally. Great job!!
author: Deron J.

description: This place is amazing ! Elaine is very nice and was very kind even though they were very very very busy. nice place, good food, lucky i live so close to it !
author: Scrapp H.

description: Amazing walnut prawns, garlic eggplant, and pineapple chicken. Ate in with friends once and these dishes were great, ordered delivery another time and they were timely and the food was hot and delicious. Especially enjoyed the walnut prawns, super unhealthy but they were the perfect mix of sweet, salty, crunchy and sauce.
author: Daryl L.

description: Prompt delivery - from order to doorstep was about 45 minutes. I ordered the fried chicken wings, pork shu mai, and egg fried rice. Chicken wings were super crispy sprinkled with salt and pepper - I didn't even use the dipping sauce because they were good all on their own. Pork shu mai were larger than I expected, the meat was very flavorful. Egg fried rice had just the right amount of soy and egg. I think they threw in a egg drop sour soup and 2 oranges for free, which was very thoughtful :). I am not a fan of the sour soups, but definitely appreciate the gesture!
author: Anna D.

description:
My go-to Chinese joint in the neighborhood for takeout. The food is great and really satisfies that Chinese food craving. I would never sit down for a meal here, however. There is no ambience, the TV playing Chinese movies seems more for the staff than the customers, and in this family-owned establishment, the children play and do their homework. Not the setting for an enjoyable meal. 

TL;DR get takeout, don't sit down.
author: Johnny W.

description: In this service people feel warm! I have eaten in many places Chinese food! But here the food is not only delicious! Hungry, that they will think of here! Great
author: Jacob Y.

description:
We went to Sam Woo's first due to the hour (10:15pm). Screw Sam Woo's, it wasn't late enough to ignore the horrid service (fine after a drunken club night).

So we went to this place. YEAH! They let us dine-in even though we arrive 10 minutes before closing (VERY COOL!). We received PHENOMENAL SERVICE from the second we opened the door. HOT Jasmine Tea was delicious.

He wanted to modify an entree... NO PROBLEMO ;)
Triple Delicetession - 4 meats no veg ($11.99)

I asked for an entree that wasn't on the menu... NO Problemo ;)
Salt & Pepper Chicken with tons of chiles (used green jalapenos) - $6.99

Combination House Fried Rice (large portion with whole shrimp) - $6.95
Appetizer for Two (4 items each) - 7.99
  -Spring Roll (lumpia style - very fresh)
  -Crab Rangoon WonTon (holy smokes, YUM!)
  -Potsticker (meaty and fresh)
  -Tempura Shrimp (large shrimp nice light batter)

Pros: 
Outstanding Service
Good Food
Good Sized Portions (important)
Special Requests are no problem
Fresh Ingredients
We had leftovers :)

Cons: 
I could see how parking might be an issue (daytime)

We have named GREEN GARDEN as our new late night dinner choice ;) 
PS Sam Woo's.... ONLY if it's the ONLY place open.
author: Madison M.

description: I'll keep this simple: considering price, quality, proportions, and service, this is the best value I've had at any restaurant anywhere. If I lived in San Fran, I'd eat here constantly. Just go.
author: Drew S.

description: Elaine's was great. We ordered delivery using Yelp's service (Eat24, I think) and it arrived very quickly. The General Tso's and Sesame Chicken that we got were moist and flavorful and it was nice that the restaurant vented the containers so that the chicken didn't get soggy. My General Tso's chicken was especially good -- I ordered it medium and it had a small but pleasant kick to it. I'd definitely order from Elaine's again!
author: Harry S.

description: Awful service. Ordered delivery and it took 1 hr 45 min. Meal was fine, not much chicken in my pineapple chix. Fried rice is good.
author: Erin F.

description: Very friendly, genuine people running this place. Food was at a reasonable price as well.
author: Amin S.

description: I'm home sick today.  I ordered cashew chicken, mapo tofu, wonton soup and dumplings to get me through the weekend.  It came out to about $40. and was delivered in about 30 minutes.  AND...they gave me 3 oranges!  That was so nice and I need them to fight my cold!
author: S. Y.

description: The owner is super sweet and the chef made pretty good food. Super cheap as it is still new.
author: Joyce L.

description: Good food, great service and great delivery service as well. Quality of taste is great compared to many other Chinese places in the district!
author: Namira B.

description: Amazing service, a family owned restaurant and you can tell they put their love into each bite! Food is amazing.
author: Dana N.

description: Got delivery, and the service was on time.  Good was good, packed well and looks like it will be good for leftovers :)
author: Brian C.

description: LOVE the chicken fried rice, won ton soup, hot and sour soup, and EVERYTHING. The best in THE CITY and fab service.
author: Cherlyn M.

description:
My parents decided to order from Green Garden one night for 8 people (two families) because they found the menu hanging on their door... They ordered so much food and a lot of it was really yummy! I particularly liked the hot and sour soup (always my fave!) and the vegetables deluxe. However, some of the food was a bit too greasy for my tastes especially the noodles and some of the chicken. We also got fortune cookies this time from Green Garden... 

So, when my friends wanted chinese food take-out for dinner, I ordered from Green Garden. I would have liked to order brown rice with my food but they only have white and fried rice. I again loved the hot and sour soup and the girls loved the Mongolian beef (I'm not much of a beef eater). For three of us and way more than enough food the bill was about $36 including tipping the delivery guy. The delivery was fast too! Where were our fortune cookies though?! Did they run out? Who serves Chinese food without fortune cookies?!
author: Meghan P.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat in SF. I love their crab cheese puffs, egg flower soup, shrimp fried rice. For $15 you can have full lunch or dinner.
author: Fred S.

description: This review is for the customer service I received from Julie. How awesome and amazing. Thank you.
author: Jarrod R.

description: Good food . Food is great. Fast food. My favorite dishes is Mongolian beef. They delivery very fast!!
author: Angel Z.

description: I tried the delivery. They were an hour late. The food was almost cold. It was also not very good. Definitely would not recommend. There are just too many great places in this city for that to be acceptable unfortunately. Something seriously has to be off about the really good yelp reviews. It's that ridiculous.
author: Melissa M.

description: I got delivery from Elaine's kitchen. Got Kung Pao Chicken and Shanghai Dumplings. Not only did the order reach in 30 mins but both dishes tasted great and came in big portions. The prices were reasonable too. I am definitely ordering from here again.
author: Shay P.

description: Excellent spot for a great workday lunch!  Lunch plates for $6.50! Woot!  How can you beat that!  Get the salt and pepper fish over rice!  Hella good yo!  Portions are huge.
author: Peter M.

description: Ordered sesame chicken. Ok. Tasted  cheap. Fried rice was flavorless. maybe I'll try something different next time.
author: John D.

description: this is a really good restaurant that opens in the last few months . Food here is delicious, and the service is decent as well. My favorite dish is mogolian beef,which is better than the same dish in all restaurants in sf. Environment is good and deliver is fast as well. highly recommended.
author: Nikki C.

description: The Green Garden Restaurant is the epitome of the type of restaurant I would be proud to be a regular at. You won't get style points for this place. It's a humble, small, mom and pop establishment that's been around for a while amidst some of the more active "nightlife" in the City. (Enough said that the restaurant is located on Broadway, SF's popular hangout for strip clubs and nightclubs - hey, whatever you're into, more power to you. I can't judge, I let the 'playa' play) But let's not confuse form over function. What you'll get is great people serving great food. I was part of a construction project across the street from this restaurant and came here often with the crew. That was 4 years ago and to this day, the owners still remember me and welcomed me with fried rice. How's that for customer service? The owners are here 7 days a week, unlike the other businesses in the Fi-Di where they're only open Monday-Friday. The husband owner rides his bike around town to deliver orders. It humbles me every time I see that. The food is also impeccable. I wish I took photos of all the dinners I had here in the past; no worries, time to start now. I remember always 'feening' for Mongolian Beef at this place and that's what I ordered. It was as good as I remembered. Much more authentic than other restaurants around. So, before you drop it like it's hot or make it rain, get filled up here first before you start chatting up the ladies - both the dance floor and dance pole varieties. =)
author: Mike L.

description: I hit on Elaine's buy accident.  I was working near by and stopped in for lunch.  What a pleasant surprise.  Excellent service but more importantly the food is delicious!  I unfortunately do not work or live near by but I make it a point to visit Elaine's at least once a month for my fix.  The best fried rice I have ever had.  Everything I have tried has been exceptional.  No this is not my family business. :)
author: Mary Ann G.

description: I work in the area and come here for lunch occasionally. The food is tasty and the portions are hearty. I don't know how to say this in English but the food has the taste of being cooked in high heat, which caramelizes the surface ever so slightly, a signature of classic Asian stir fry. Which is great. Their location is slightly outside of Chinatown which means that they probably have to work harder instead of rely on random tourists to walk in. To sum it all up, I feel this is a fairly solid place for typical style Chinese food.
author: Winston W.

description:
Perfect place for quick and delicious Chinese food with good ingredients. Stopped by for vegetable dumplings and chicken wings. The wings were good, but the dumplings were really impressive. Flavorful, steamy veggies wrapped and lightly fried. What stood out were the peas (among other veggies) which were soft and sweet. The portions were big, and price very reasonable.

It's family run and the kids are there, watching TV or helping with the food. The father himself bikes around to do deliveries. 
The interior is nothing to write home about. Clean and simple decor.
All in all great Chinese food for a small family establishment.
author: Arthur X.

description: This is my go to place for a quick lunch. Super fast and food is always good. I've eaten hear about 15 times and have never had a bad lunch. All the food has a lot of flavor. The staff is always friendly and nice. Service is quick and price is cheap. 5 star decor ? No, but I come hear for consistent Chinese food. Not for the decor
author: James T.

description: Quality food and great taste at an affordable price. The portions are huge and the food is delicious. Decor and service are so so, but that's just not what most Asian restaurants focus on. I will definitely go back.
author: Ana C.

description:
a friend recommended this place for lunch take out.

the server was nice and helpful.
I order salt & pepper pork with fried rice lunch combo.
I ended up getting the pork with steam rice.  ugh!
pork was definitely too salty for my liking.

the place was small but clean.

street parking in broadway so it can be tough.

overall, I was a bit disappointed with the food but I'd give them another chance.
author: Learnee L.

description: Located by the edge of broadway. Dropped by on a whim thanks to yelp :) Hands down one of the best places I've been to for hot & sour soup not watered down like some places and a bit of kick.. Also had the Mongolian beef that was pretty good. Give it a shot if ya ever around the area.
author: Wayne T.

description:
I had the sesame chicken lunch special.  It came with an egg roll (surprisingly good), tea which was an extra fee (okay), and fried rice.  The chicken was a little too oily and tart, but edible.  

The kitchen looked really dirty.  In fact, the whole place seemed unclean.
author: Niniane W.

description: I eat here all the time for lunch time when I am working on Broadway, let me just say fast service and free delivery. The food is always good, never ordered anything I did not like. Fried chicken wings and Mongolian Beef are to die for... literally!
author: Renee B.

description: I go here for lunch at least once a week. This place has one of the best Mongolian Beef Rice dish. All lunch comes with a small bowl of soup (Hot&Sour) and Veg. Egg Rolls. The Hot&Sour soup here is usually very good.  Better than the ones in Chinatown. Also, the Eggplant dish with Chicken&Shrimp is also excellent . The waiter/waitress and owner are very friendly too.
author: Wain C.

description: I come here two or three times a month at lunch time. The food is hot and fresh and the service is great. Besides, it's just a few blocks from my home. It's all good!
author: Paula H.

description:
Thought I would try out this place... it was open late and within walking distance of work.. so I picked up some food for me and my boyfriend to go...

The service there was really good and the food came out fresh and hot.... but when got home I took a closer look at my noodle dish.. I noticed that the used the wrong noodles... but since I was home might as well right... yeah that was a bad mistake.. my stomach was hurting the next day.. I called up my boyfriend and he had the sam problem with his too..
author: Lena S.

description: Great service. The american waiter even know how to speak Cantonese! He should have set the table with chop sticks though. The food and that's the main reason why I came was excellent. Vegetables have a bite (string beans with chicken and veggie chow mein). Best are the walnut prawns!  ( they were just a littlebit too soft) oh I got a free soup and cheese dumplin. Best price quality chinese ever!
author: Belgian D.

description: The food at Green Garden was very delightful!  The food was so fresh, and the service was prompt and very helpful!  Look forward to going back on our next visit for sure!!
author: Donna C.

description: It's great to get a healthy Chinese place that takes good care of it's customers! Great place for food deliveries!
author: James T.

description: Attentive service, personal staff, clean, modern decor, delicious food: wonton soup, house special eggplant, salt & pepper fried fish fillet. We will come back.
author: Giang N.

description:
Think the sesame chicken looks good? Do not be deceived! I got the sesame chicken lunch meal with rice and it tasted pretty good. A couple hours later, I was on the toilet throwing up for hours. This place definitely gave me food poisoning...so while it may be cheap and taste good, I will not, under any circumstances, be back. 

Just a warning.
author: Hannah L.

description: Excellent lunch, chicken was fresh and moist. Fried rice was some of the best I have had.
author: Roddy M.

description: Very good food, great prices and nice, clean space. We were worried as the place was empty upon arrival but the food did not disappoint. Especially liked the complementary hot and sour soup and delicious crab cheese puffs, as well as the veggie potstickers and Kung Pao tofu. Would definitely return.
author: Geoffrey U.

description:
Gave it another chance. This place is actually really good. You wouldn't be able to tell walking by. But I have eaten here a number of times and enjoyed it every time.

Pot stickers and sesame chicken is what I get. Mmmmmm....
author: Mike A.

description: Cheese crab puffs are delicious! I'd give them 5 stars just for that. However, was very disappointed with the walnut prawns/shrimp. Batter is way too thick and the sauce is not creamy like most places. Very clean restaurant and friendly staff though.
author: Autumn M.

description: I ordered food for delivery via GrubHut. It came quickly, and a bonus is the fried stuff was vented so it didn't come soggy. In my online order instructions I asked for less salt, less oil and no MSG. I believe they did all that. On top of it all, it's not bad Chinese food. There aren't many decent Chinese delivery places in SF, I think this is one that I will try again.
author: Lesty L.

description:
Having read good reviews of this place on other websites, I was keen to try it out myself. I was quite surprised to be the only guest when I entered the restaurant on a sunday night at 7.30pm. Restaurant might also be an inappropriate description of the place, which resembled a mixture of a fast food place (interior and decoration) and the family's living room at the same time. I personally don't mind that, but be prepared to have the kids around doing their homework, browsing music videos on youtube, or just talking in Chinese with their parents. 
The food was served within minutes of my order. My tastebuds said the food wasn't special in any regard, I'd rather say it was average americanized Chinese cuisine. A remark on the side: I ain't sure if it's usual that rice has to be ordered as a side dish, but it's an extra 1.50$ for a small bowl. After all, I enjoyed my dinner there, even though it was somewhat special.
author: i486

description:
I like Green Garden for many reasons:

1.) They have crab cream cheese Rangoons... my favorite. 
2.) The Orange and Lemon Chicken are very good and prepared totally differently from one another. Lemon chicken is a big piece of meat, while orange chicken is the small fried pieces. Now you can alternate and it seems like two totally different meals.
3.) The rice is nice and sticky.
4.) The delivery man rides up on a bike with an orange crate attached to the back. Rain or shine he shows up with hot food. Now that's commitment! How can you not like that?
author: Natalie N.

description: Born and raised in San Francisco this is some of the best sweet and sour chicken I've ever eaten. Tonight's batch was a bit greasy which is why they lost a star. The people are friendly the food is fast cheap and good. Fed myself and my fiance for 11.50
author: Kami M.

description:
Cute Chinese restaurant and good service. 

They use nice dishes instead of the normal cheap Asian ones, but it doesn't make the food taste better. We had hot and sour soup, fried rice and green beans with chicken. I also like the beef with peppers and black bean sauce. 

The portions are generous, but I was disappointed with how there were hardly any chicken the green beans/chicken dish. I think it's because we were there late. 

The couple that works here are very friendly and nice. They recognize us and always looks happy to see us.
author: Gladys C.

description:
Yes, there are better Chinese places out there in the city, but when your only other option for Chinese food lunches within walking distance of the office is Levi's Plaza's overpriced, oversauced and overall subpar Yan Can Cook Kung Pao lunch special, you'd be likened to agree with me. 

Every time I come here, I am greeted with a smile, a cup of water, and an eggroll. When I walk back to my office to eat at my desk (how's that for efficiency!?) I am always so excited to open up my takeout container of delicious food. On some days it's the asparagus beef, other days, it's the won ton soup, but there are numerous lunch specials to satiate my hunger, all conveniently priced from $5.95-6.95. I can always guarantee that the food is hot, fresh, and most importantly, fantastic. 

Coming here almost makes me forget that I'm but a wee cog in the big wheel of corporate America. 

Almost...


EDIT- Wait, not really.
author: Clarissa S.

description: I'm giving Green Garden 5 stars not only because their mushu pork is the best I've ever had, but it's really the fact they remember me and even call me the mushu pork lady. They make me feel welcome and appreciated and my belly is appreciative when it's full of their food.
author: Nikki A.

description: I come to this place to eat with my boyfriend alot, because its always quiet and never crowded. The family is always super sweet and friendly. We usually spend around $20 for the both of us, which is awesome! And normally get a plate of fried rice and a plate of chicken, and always have a good amount of leftovers. The food comes out super quick and is delicious. I love looking at all the different teapots in the case. Very good restaurant and totally worth the money!
author: Ally A.

description:
5 STARS BABY! 
Green Garden rules, hands down!
Lunch Menu totally rocks with down-to-earth prices and good porportions.

Soup and Wonton in-your-face the moment you sit down just to get you warmed up. 

Adequate service is like cherry on the top.
author: David C.

description:
A mere 4 blocks away unknowing tourists line up for sickly sweet slop at House of Nanking.  What for?

Green Garden is on the opposite end of the spectrum. It is basic, simple, unpretentious.

Oh, and very, very cheap. Really cheap. And fast.  Like Wonderdog fast.

Portions are very large, though to be fair they tend to be heavy on veggies and light on meat. I dont view this as a negative, but just know what you should expect.

As is usual for chinese dives they have a rice-plate based lunch menu. Everythign I've had is good, espcially the Royal Pork (simple slices of roast pork with perfectly stirfried greens) and the Spicy Eggplant (not oily as at most places.)  A bowl of soup, an entre with rice, a small salad, a wedge of orange, tea and a cookie cost around $5.  Try doing that at home.

The dinner menu has the same items, and again they are well, if simply executed.  Try the stir fried green beens if you want a veggie option. Crispy, kissed with garlic but not overpowering, and a nice sesame oil sheen.

Everyone needs to have a place like the Green Garden in their hood (alas I don't, though Brandy Ho is openeing a branch 100 feet from my house in the Castro, so I'll live.)

For what it is, this place delivers.  Give it a shot.
author: hOWARD y.

description:
I work about 5 blocks from this restaurant and must say it's the best Chinese food around. 
The only catch is that if you're allergic to MSG (even mildly) you may want to stay away. Or as others have said here, be willing to leave with that good old MSG buzz.
author: Vivi F.

description: I was very surprised that this Chinese restaurant actually served one of the best hamburger and fries I have ever eaten in this neighborhood along Broadway! The Double Cheeseburger with Mushrooms along with fries was excellent. The sesame seed bun was perfectly toasted, the beef patties were juicy, the mushrooms were properly sauteed, and I think, so were the pickles. The Fries were excellent and crispy and unsalted--good, because I sprinkled my own amount of salt to my own taste. This is a great place for a good burger at a good price along this side of Broadway.
author: Robert T.

description: This is probably more of a 2.5 stars - meaning, if they didn't deliver, I would not go out of my way to eat here.  Their delivery was quick (about 35 min.) but I also live pretty close to the restaurant.  I ordered the Hong Kong Pan Fried Noodles with Seafood, green onion pancakes, and hot and sour soup.  The noodles seemed to be a little light on the toppings (seafood, veggies, and sauce), but was okay.  I don't suggest the green onion pancakes - they were crispy on the edges but soggy in the middle.  The hot and sour soup was solid - not the best, but not bad either.  So, if you're hungry, this place delivers hot, adequate Chinese food.
author: Amy C.

description:
I was back from the gym early so decided to order from Green Garden for dinner. 35 min. after placing my order arrived, my food was f*ing hot and spicy, just the way I like it! IF YOU WANT TO KNOW WHY I'M GIVING THIS PLACE 2 STARS, JUST READ THE LAST PARAGRAPH!

I ordered the pork potstickers, the chicken salad, and General Tsao's chicken (out of respect for General Tsao, although I'm not sure who he is, I am capitalizing his name and title). The pork potstickers were absolutely delicious, with the right amount of crispiness on the outer edges and perfectly cooked pork on the inside. I couldn't put them down and when I was done, I hated myself for eating them in such a hurry instead of savoring each and every bite. Next time, I'll be sure to place two orders of the potstickers for sure!

The chicken salad was decent. There's tons of raw onion in the salad (and not red onions, that usually make  salads oh so delicious) but the white kind, that just tastes way too oniony and blehhhh overall. After trying to pick out all the onion bits and pieces for about 15 min., I just gave up on the salad. I guess it's partly my fault for expecting a quality salad from a Chinese restaurant. 

What people say about huge portions is definitely true. My General Tsao's chicken was huge! And it lasted me for three whole days (which is good in this economy). The dish was warm when it arrived, and the chicken was fried to perfection! This is something that I would definitely order from Green Garden again! Although I'm interested in trying other dishes in the future as well. 

The reason I'm giving this place two stars is because of the extremely creepy, creepy, creepy CREEEEEEEPPPPPPPY middle-aged delivery guy with a creepy creepy CREEEEEEPY smile. When I answered the door, I promptly gave him the money that I owed him (along with a generous tip) and expected him to hand me the food and leave. After all, it should have been a simple and quick transaction (kind of like those drug deals that happen on Law & Order series). But instead he forced the door open, started commenting on how nice my apartment was and proceeded to take a step or two inside, looking all up and down my apartment, as if I was having a full blown open-house and he was Donald Trump. Finally I got so annoyed that I had to say, "Excuse me, what the hell do you think you are doing?" at which point, he realized how inappropriate his actions were and stepped out again. Seriously, it was as if he was trying to make up his mind whether to rob my place or let me live another day. I quickly proceeded to shut the door firmly on his CREEEEPPPPY face and use all the locks on my door + move all my furniture to the door so it would not budge. Considering the decent food and hefty portions, I would like to order from this place again, but ONLY if they get a new delivery guy that's not so rude/ CREEEEEEPY.
author: Andrew C.

description: It used to be a very busy place .. some 5 yrs back. what happened? Still cheap and ok food. if they do some menu chgs and improve taste a little, this can be busy again.
author: yelper l.

description: This is one of the better quality, lesser-known Chinese restaurants in SF.  The location up on the hill by the lounges and strip clubs on Broadway St. isn't really ideal for most people who are in a rush during lunch.  That's unfortunate too, b/c they use really fresh ingredients, give very generous portions, and all for a really cheap price. too.  If you're able to make the trek up to Broadway St, you should definitely stop by this restaurant and give it a try.
author: Minh V.

description: I only order one item at this place, really, but I've tried the other stuff and liked it. They usually charge a delivery fee if your order is under $20 during lunch, but the people at my work always order from this place so they pretty much let us slide. The delivery guy is a really nice guy, and I hope to one day eat in there again now that I hope to run into Natalie G. there... just kidding. But really, I would like to actually eat at the restaurant then to be stuck in the office during lunch.
author: Rommel N.

description:
after the 'remodel' at green garden i've been there about five times in two weeks.  i generally stick to 'garden' variety Chinese when i'm at a Chinese place serving the proverbial 5 dollar lunch plate.
THAT being said, the Sesame Chicken is incredible.  Reminiscent of General Chicken but a touch sweeter and not spicy.  
The won tons and sweet and sour soup add a nice touch to the bargain.
Oh, did i mention that i everytime i leave this place i feel high?  I know a good MSG buzz when i get one and GG is currently my hook up for the good stuff.  As Dennis once said, MSG = Make Shit Good.
Pure genius.
author: Karl H.

description:
So I tried ordering from Green Garden twice. It seems to have fairly decent reviews here so I wanted to give them a try...here's what happenned.

The first time I ordered delivery online from eat24hours.com. 20 minutes later I received a call explaining that there were no drivers tonight, and they were very sorry...um, ok...weird, but no huge deal. I was kind of annoyed but figured it was a freak accident.

A week later, I felt like Chinese again, so I figured...let's give Green Garden a 2nd chance. So I placed an order online again, this time for lunch time. I was starving and really couldn't wait to eat and I was feeling fairly excited about the decision to get delivery.... Ok, so 20 minutes go by again and I receive a call from a woman saying they cannot find my address on the map??? Ok, so I explain to them the cross streets (which were in my order) and then gave her explicit directions with landmarks. The woman asks if I can pick it up...I tell her that I cannot right now, so she says she will try again to find it. Sooo 15 minutes go by...and I get another call. Guess what, she STILL can't find it on her map. I ask if they have a computer...they dont? Not sure how they can receive their online orders without one, but OK...I am kind of annoyed now and ready to review your establishment on YELP!!! 

Ok now I feel better!
author: Scott V.

description: I am a fan of the wonton noodle soup, but I really only go here for lunch if the weather is bad.  Don't be suprised if they ask you to move tables to accomodate larger parties.  It happens all the time.  Sometimes it's awkward.
author: T-Bone L.

description: Went here for some lunch action and they have a complete lunch deal for a reasonable price.  A good menu selection of choices. So for about 7 dollars you get sweet & sour soup, hot crunchy potsticker and a good filling main dish. But only 3 stars, not superb chinese food, but definitely not putting the chinese cooking to shame.
author: MJ T.

description: Really good Chinese food. Cheap lunches. Good quality meat and sauces. And of course awesome techno at noon and you get a free chicken wing if you avoid the lunch rush. How could you go wrong?
author: Andy D.

description: Update! The Wok Shop Cafe definitely has better goons. Sweet, delicious and plentiful!
author: Shawn P.

description: Go here at least a couple of times a month for lunch.  $6.50 for awesome mongolian beef and white rice with complimentary soup and egg roll.  quick serivce, HUGE portions and good price.  also have tried the orange chicken/generals chicken type dish which was good.  mongolian beef is by far the best though.
author: Daniel M.

description: Ah a quick and easy favorite. I eat here when I don't feel like spending $10 on a salad. Food is pretty tasty, and at lunch, you get hot & sour soup and egg roll included with your main course. Order off the special lunch menu, all this tastiness can be yours for, max, $8. I particularly enjoy the basil tofu.
author: Madhavi K.

description: Best Chinese delivery I could find after three years living in SOMA.
author: Zak J.

description: not really a place that i go for authentic chinese food. but definitely a place for an excellent lunch bargain! most of the rice plates i've had have been really tasty and the portions pretty huge. the most recent dish that i really enjoyed there was the eggplant with shrimp and chicken. plus they give you a bowl of soup and an eggroll, all for around 6-7 bucks. not too shabby i must say! now i just gotta find a way to stay awake for the rest of the afternoon...
author: Steven L.

description: A disappointment.  We ordered for the first time and had it delivered.  The food was far below average and we expected more.  There was "mystery meat" in the Hong Kong noodles, the orange chicken was not as good as we are used to and we didn't know they wouldn't include white rice so we had to make some.  The vegetable egg rolls turned out to be the best item we ordered but they gave us hardly any sauce for the egg rolls.  It seemed like they cut costs everywhere they could. We'll try something different next time.
author: Joy J.

description: good food but don't get food to go here. they put it in the now banned Styrofoam containers which melt into your hot food. everyone should let them know this illegal in san francisco and could cause you cancer.
author: angela p.
